text: Love their food! The tomm kha, pad thai, and green curry are my favorite!! And their thai coffee!!!! Ahhhhh. I work 2 minutes away from here and this is my go to place!!

I saw many good reviews about this place so I wanted to give it a try.  Sadly I  have to say I was disappointed in the one item I ordered. I ordered an or of Pad see eew for lunch and it came out very quickly. There was only 1 table dining when I placed the togo order which I got in less than 5 minutes. I paid about $10 bucks but wasn't  able to enjoy it at all. The noodles were so greasy that there was a layer of oil at the bottom of the togo box. The noodles were all broken into small pieces and soggy. Total disappointment!

The food was decent but the service was awful. First they ran out of white rice so we had to wait for that. They forgot one of the order so we had to wait an additional 20 minutes, after my whole party had finished eating. The waiters had no interest in customer service. Our waiter was by himself working the whole restaurant, he did the best he could. They need to hire more servers and probably more cooks. I will not be returning to this restaurant.
Lady chased us out before we could order, and rushed us when we were the only ones in there. Probably good food but horrible service.

Kinda busy Sunday night. Waited 45+ minutes for one order of pad Thai when it was promised 15mins. I asked for a refund and they voided the wrong order and I had to come back once again to get my order refunded. They had no commission and still wanted to charge me to reorder the food even though they were the ones that made the mistake. Please NEVER NEVER COME HERE!!!!!!This place is going downhill and most likely will not be doing business with them anymore
This is a typical lunch place for my colleagues and I.  There's lots of variety and so far all have been satisfying.  The service is great as well.

This place is our go to when we don't know where else to eat. The price for the food is very affordable. The food had always been good; not anything superb or spectacular though. It's like home cooked food.

I'm surprised that other people said customer service is lacking. In my experience, been here about six times, they have always been polite and pleasant. They do not have chit chat kind of customer service, which I prefer, I guess.

We have been there for three times, each time they just gave us less and less noodles in the soup, we had to order extra noodles.  Their beef noodle soup taste good, but the portion is so small my 3 year old can finish it in no time. The fried noodles is the same, small portion!  Won't go back again!

We were there with friends and with our kids. First they only had 2 high chairs so other 2 parents had to sit their kids in their strollers. Then a lady came took our order and our meal came out one at a time every 5 to 10 minutes later. Our food should have came out all together. But it didn't end there it seem they made a mistake with one of our order and it never came out so we ask them to cancel it because it seem they had  made a mistake and had not put in this order with the kitchen or wrong order was put in. This is when the fun begin, their server didnt even apologize and try to make us pay for the mistake when we told them to cancel it. The server said ok and we told them we will pay our bills. The cashier didnt give us our bill and just gave us a total amount (illegal) which we gave her our card. Then we realize the amount didnt add up so we asked for the bill there is when we found out they charge us for the cancel order and didn't want to show they charge it by not trying to show us our bills. So we had them void the last charge and charge the correct bill minus the cancel order. Still no apology and just yelling from the cashier. We will stop going to this place. The worst cashier in Las Vegas is here. This was one place we use to meet and eat.

Went here once and ordered the Thai Style Noodle (I think that's what it was called lol) with a spicy level 3. It was so delicious and the spice level was just right for me. The portion was great for the price paid and I definitely want to come back and try other dishes!

I'm so glad this location opened! My roommate and I would always drive to the TSNH 2 which sometimes felt so far when we're both starving and craving the food lol. Now it's a minute away :) The food is delicious, the servers are always nice & polite, and the prices are unbelievably affordable.

So glad they opened one near my place. It was kind of a hassle to drive to Chinatown for my favorite Chicken Pad Thai, but now It's literally 5 minutes away. 
I still favor the original place to this one the cooking there seems better, but its still okay here.

I recommend you try the fried wontons too if you want a snack pretty good.
Food has gone bad. Waitress didn't even say sorry. Don't go this place.  You are going to be sick.

I usually eat here so it pains me to write this. I just picked up my favorite pod won sen and mango sticky rice. The pod won sen tasted dry and overcooked which wasn't terrible but a little annoying. I was so excited about the mango sticky rice but the mango was all dry and rotted inside and I ate half of it before noticing it. So now I feel sick and gross.  Maybe one should not eat cheap Thai food :/

WARNING! DO NOT EVER ORDER FROM THIS PLACE!
The lady that takes their orders need to be replaced... I ordered a chicken thai basil leaf ala cart for dinner which she repeat to me and when I picked up my order and got home...SUPRISE SUPRISE  they gave me a lunch menu(during dinner time)... called them back for a refund all they can give me is a store credit. After this event do they actually think I'm gonna go back for this business...

I love Thai food, and I've had authentic Thai soup (not featured in any menu) before made by chefs and went crazy because how delicious it was.

At first, I thought the soup was good but as I kept on eating I felt the soups we ordered (duck noodle and beef noodle) were a little too sweet for my taste. Usually Thai food comes with the seasoning sides, I prefer pickled Thai chillies than jalape√±os (that's what they serve). 

Service was slow. Our friend, who paid for the check, had to walk up to the server while she was eating asked for refills and if we could order more noodles lol.

I decided to try this place for the first time and I have to say; I love it! I've never had a single Thai place that I preferred but now I have a favorite!

The food was excellent with generous portions and a price that was unbelievably cheap. The atmosphere was comfy and spacious with very polite workers, they even enjoy getting to know you and talk to you, I felt absolutely welcomed!

I always go to Thai noodle house and order food to-go. Usually the same thing beef pad Thai spicy #8, but this time they got my order wrong. After they were the ones that made the mistake they expected me to drive all the way back to their location and exchange for the correct item. I work in food and what we usually do is credit the item for the customer but instead they just kept giving attitude over the phone and eventually hung up on me

First off, loyal customers and fans of this place. I never thought I would 1 star this restaurant, it was my favorite place just before what you're about to read, I swear! 
But just as I would go to a restaurant with mediocre food and great service, I will not support a restaurant with good food and horrible service. PLEASE, be non bias when reading, thanks.
Ordered a few panang curries and 2 noodle items, carryout. The panang curries were very watered down and tasted like it, usually it's perfect and that's why we ordered there so often. But hey mistakes happen, no biggie right, right.
So... We called... They asked us to drive back the food, for replacements. At first I didnt want to call, because it was 10 minutes there and then 10 minutes back and the rest of the food not messed up would be cold returning home. But I called because every restaurant deserves a chance to correct their mistake. So I called, they told us if we drove the food back they would have our replacements. So I went, because hey, that's $25 of food I paid for and 20 min to get what I paid for right? 
No problem I guess, seemed like an easy fix even tho it took an extra trip, but that's NOT what they did. 
I walked in and the management immediately, let me say again, "immediately" got angry and raised thier voices at me. I was shocked, thrown off and confused. I thought I was just picking up replacements of a few mess ups as I brought the food back like I was told. Walking into a place I go to on a regular and then getting yelled at for something I had no control over (food mistakes).
So I cut off both of them yelling at me, and asked them questions. 
I asked why they were mad at me for the mistakes they see and admitted to, no reply from either manager. I asked why would they yell at me, a regular customer, after I drove back and brought back the food as asked. Again no response.
THIS IS WHERE THE 1 STAR KICKS IN FOR SURE.
They didn't replace the mistakes they made, right they said they would over the phone. Even seeing it for themselves first hand. 
They had us drive back there then changed the offer to, remaking 1 of 3. WOW, really? 
Not only did I have to wait for the 1 of 3 to be remade, I paid for 3 and got 1 remake (that's not what I was told on the phone), I had to drive back there and waste my time, returned home to 2 cold noodle dishes that are supposed to be served hot.
Returning home to the cold noodles and 4 hungry friends/coworkers. I walked in feeling frustrated and still confused to why they did that to me, why they got mad at me, the customer. My friends suggested yelp after I explained what had happemed. They said they will back up the yelp, as they were let down on their first experience with the restaurant. 
SORRY thai style noodle house, but I've never in my life experienced such rude and disrespectful behavior from a business I truly once enjoyed.
This place is good. The fried rice is bomb! The delivery time was quick. I have only tried a few things, but I am definitely going back.

We have been eating at this place for the past 5 months at least twice a week sometimes more. Tonight we placed of order and waited at least 30 mins. before we started to get our food. I got mine, dad got his about 5 mins. later (part of it anyways) and Sas got hers 10 mins. after dad. Meanwhile we saw at least 7 to go orders come in after us and ordered and leave with their food before ours. The waitress didn't even apologize for the inconvenience. Last time we will be dining there. Word of advise to others that don't want to waste your time waiting. Go some where else. We are !!

My client and I took a shot in the dark on this place being we never had or heard of it. But it was top notch! I had the yellow chicken curry with rice level 5 spicy! REALLY good. I'd recommend it and I'll definitely be back! Plus great customer service! Thank you guys

I just moved close to this place so I gave it a try. Got the shrimp and chicken nooddle. Omg it really was delicious! Everything looked fresh, vegetables crunchy and perfectly tasty. Also very cheap!! Will def try more of their menu!
The staff here are so friendly and the food is legit Thai. They are always willing to go the extra mile. What a wonderful place!

I was here for lunch on a Friday with my friend. There were plenty of parking spaces. When I walked in I was pleasantly surprised how nicely decorated this restaurant is. We were sat down immediately by a very friendly waitress. We told her we were new to this restaurant and asked her what she recommended, she said I'll be right back. We waited and waited and she never came back. After 10 minutes we were able to waive down another waitress. We asked her what is the best Curry they have and she said there's no best Curry, just order what you like. Omg. We ordered green curry with shrimp, Thai ice tea and spicy Thai noodle with chicken. 20 minutes later they brought our Curry out, it was delicious.  We waited for another 15 minutes and our other dish still did not come out. 25 minutes later they brought out the spicy noodle dish, that was also delicious. I'm giving the food there 5 stars and the slow service brought it down to 3 stars. Please hire more servers, two are not enough for your lunch rush. I will definitely come back for the food and hopefully there will be more servers hired.

I've been here a few times and my review reflects all of the visits, but will focus on my most recent visit. 

We were not welcomed when we walked in. I've made eye contact with at least two employees by the kitchen but no one made the attempt to sit us or even say hello to us while we were just standing around the entrance waiting to be seated until at least a minute later. 

However, when we were seated and ready to order, the older lady was very kind in taking our orders. 

The food came out pretty timely and reasonably delicious for the price that they offer. 

I will continue to use this place when I crave Thai food. I just hope that their customer service gets better.

I was here for lunch with my family. There were plenty of parking spaces. When I walked in I was pleasantly surprised how nicely decorated this restaurant is. We were sat down immediately. About 5 minutes the waitress brought water for us, and I asked if we can order, she replied with a bad attitude, it seemed like she was very angry. I don't know her name, but she had short hair and a tattoo on her arm. Unprofessional waitress, bad service. The food was delicious. I'm giving the food there 3 stars and the service brought it down to 0 stars. Please hire more servers, two are not enough for your lunch rush. I will never come back for the bad service.

Best boat noodle in vegas! Not sure if it's affiliated with any of the other locations but the food at this one was the best. I've been looking for a place with authentic beef noodle here for years and this place is just amazing. I will be returning.

First time eating here. The service was ok. To start they had no lemon for my tea but the appetizer, shrimp rolls, were delicious. The chicken noodle soup was very good. I would return  and recommend this restaurant  to my friends.

This is my absolute favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. They have multiple locations around the valley but this is the location we go to every single time because of one factor; their customer service. 
Nok is our waitress on a regular and we've started to go only when we know she'll be working. If we see that's she's not working then we get back in our car and try again another day...she's just that good of a waitress. There isn't a single time that she hasn't made us feel like family and we love how she always makes sure the food is to our liking before leaving our table. We've noticed that other regulars prefer her to be their waitress as well because she makes friends with everyone and always provides excellent service. There honestly isn't enough great things I could say about her, so when you go make sure you scout out the lady with short hair and a tattoo on her arm, that's Nok! :)
Also, the food is great too

Good foods  and affordable price, the restaurant is clean too, the food  , the only problem was the server, i dont know her name but she has short and black hair she always rude . I dont know because her personality but she needs more sincere to the costumers

Casual and clean restaurant in a strip mall.  The prices are VERY reasonable with most items under $9.  Portions were good and service efficient.  We tried the pad thai and beef noodle soup.  Both were very tasty and better than any other Thai restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas.  The beef noodle soup was excellent.  Tastiest I've had in a long time and you get to set the heat level.  This is my new go to noodle place.
Love this place. Their curry with pumpkin is awesome, and I also love the duck fried rice.
Their curry is very good although the last time they skimped on the coconut milk.
Great Thai food - reminded me of the many times I visited Thailand. Priced very good, and great service. I recommend.

I frequent this spot atleast once a week. Food is great, entirely affordable, even for a family of four. This location's achilles heel has got to be the manner in which they service customers.

1.
The young man who serves during the day drops off the check and just stands there watching us figure out how we would like to split the bill saying "I'm too lazy to walk back." Normally you drop
off a check and come back whenever the patron is done.

2.
The ladies working at night are nice, and I know I came in 30 minutes before closing asking for a table for three. Can't seat us, that's fine. I'll order to go. I'm going through the menu and the lady taking the order is explaining menu items so fast its overwhelming. I finally figure out what it is we wanted to order but that "hurry up and buy" attitude needs to go.

Will be back for sure the food isnt the problem ots how the business is represented.

Worst thai I have ever eaten, service was really bad.  My tea was served in a dirty glass, and the food came out about 20 minutes apart, their were 5 of us.  Will never go there again.  Health department should check them out.

My wife and I are addicted to the grill pork salad here haha. It's just everything u want in thai food. Onions, spices, with garlic. The pork has an awesome grilled flavor, juicy. The dressing is quite tangy. It's just excellent, a must try. And u can order it without chili if u don't like hot stuff

I love the Tom Yum Noodle soup. It's delicious! The portions are huge too.

The kids had orange chicken and rice. It's enough to feed two kids. 

I called in and order was done in 15 minutes. 

The restaurant is clean and gotta love the TVs to kill time.

Just had the BBQ pork with wonton egg noodle soup and it's so good! It had Bok Choy and they are not skimpy with the ingredients. Thanks for building one of these near my house!

Ok forgot to add that I had a great experience here. Great customer service! Good job guys!

UPDATE: The S9 with pork is so good! Don't forget to dip the pork in that sauce that it comes with.

The mango sticky rice is also bomb!

Came across this hidden gem while picking up an order for Uber Eats. Grabbed a menu and decided to give it a try later in the week. 

It's not always a full house but they seem to get slammed with Uber, Postmates and DoorDash orders. Food might take longer than most places but trust me, they are cranking them out fresh. I haven't had decent Thai since I left NYC and this place knocked it out of the park! I LOVE duck so I ordered the Duck Fried Rice...I don't know what all they put in it but it was absolutely delicious and my official favorite now!

My husband tried the Chicken Pad See-ew which was also a new favorite of ours. If you have the chance, go, go, GO try it out!

Delicious!! My new fave spot!  Everything we ordered was top notch,  generous servings and great value for the price esp. when it comes to Thai Food!! Get the Orange chicken, silver glass noodles w/ chicken, thai fried rice, pork larb & thai iced tea... you will NOT be disappointed!  ;)
Pad see ew on point  their fried chicken/fried rice combo is Fuego  clean store, nice staff, great food. Overall a pretty great Thai restaurant!

Found hair in my food and tried multiple times to get our server's attention but couldn't. There were two servers. It was a very busy time for them so I understand. We waited but I ended up just sharing food with my friends because I lost appetite for mine. 

We finished our food with no one ever checking on us. We waited for the check but then found that our server seemed to be arguing with another customer about something... check never came so we went up to the counter to pay. 

I kindly told the server about the hair in my food and she didn't seem like she cared. She said "oh really?" gave me my change.
Wow. 8 bucks for a tiny portion of chicken and a ton of rice. on top of that it was extremely salty, had CANNED mushrooms and no veggies. At most they put maybe 4 oz of meat. For 8 bucks.

This is by far the BEST Thai food I've had in Vegas. Everything was fresh and delivered within 26 minutes by Uber eats. Orange chicken was light and the noodles were cooked to perfection . Def be ordering from here again!!
Good food / Good Price / Good service . I love Thai tea  and combination beef noodles soup / calamari very very very good .

I always order the pork over fried rice, spicy. It comes with soup and also two different sauces. Delicious and filling. 

Not a huge fan of their yellow curry but the panag curry is good, if you like spicy I recommend like an 8! 

If you want noodles, I prefer chicken pad seu spicy #10 over their pad Thai. 

Their spicy scale is 1-10 but I don't think their 10 is that spicy.


I always order to go and it does not take more than 20 minutes. Delivery is a bit longer.

This location has been the best so far when it comes to the food. We've been to all the other ones and it was either the service or food that wasn't great. We try everything on the menu and everything was delicious. It is also a plus being close to our house instead of driving to Chinatown and waiting forever to be seated! Sometimes it is hit or miss with the waitress not coming back to do refills or check on us but our kids enjoy the food anyway. 
The combination noodle soup is rich and tasty. They are generous with their portions too! I love that they never changed their prices which keeps us regulars coming back :) if you order papaya salad, ask for it Lao style if you don't prefer it sour like the Thai way. Red curry, pad see ew, calamari, tom kah kai and any kind of noodle soups are the usuals we get!

The Server is so CLUMSY! She spilled oil thru the spoon that dropped in my new leather wallet. They are not even sorry about the incident! What Fuc..k.ng mess! Food is ok but not worth the experience! No Service etiquette! D+

So happy I stopped in this place and gave it a try! By far the BEST pad Thai I've ever had in my life. It had a flavor so much better than I've ever had. Very simple and basic, but so delicious. I also ordered the chicken skewer app and it was great. Will definitely be back!!!
Spiciest Pad Thai I've had, good food for good price. I recommend it, just not for the service.
Ordered take out: shrimp pad Thai and egg roll. It was pretty good; it satisfied my cravings! Will definitely try to check in the restaurant next time.

I love curries so I came here. The first 3 visits went fine. However, when I came as soon as the doors open at 11am, on my 4th dine-in experience, I think they served some left overs from the night before. There were slices of french fries in my yellow chicken curry. At first bite, I thought that I was just wrong. But then, as I kept eating, it is apparent that pieces of french fries were thrown into my plate. I know for a fact that this should not be the case because I order the same meal everytime. Didn't finish my food & never came back.

Came out here on sunny afternoon for lunch. Potstickers, pineapple fried rice and sweet and sour with chicken was bomb. I replaced the rice with vegetables and it made the plate xtra bomb. Also got the chicken saut√© and It wasn't my style of food. Other then that everything was good including the service.

The service here is horrible. I went to pick up my order of chicken fried rice and orange chicken with rice. I wasn't greeted with a smile or a hello, just a pickup? I asked if she had put soy sauce in the bag and she said yeh so I looked and there was one, I said I need more than 1... she looked at me and grabbed ONE more and walked away. Two small soy sauce packets with two full entrees. Just after that I knew I never wanted to come back. Then went home to eat and that was just eh, very bland, no taste barely any chicken in the fried rice. One of the worst experiences I have ever had. Safe to say I will never ever return. Very disappointed.

One of my favorite Thai places in Vegas! I must say that this isn't the BEST Thai restaurant; however it's as good as it can get for the price! This place is right down the street from my house so I always order to-go through the phone and pick up is usually ready within 15 minutes. 

I tend to stick with the same dishes every time. Pad Thai, pad see ew, Panang curry or spicy basil beef. I've had their house fried rice, and various soups before as well, everything is always delicious! 

I think the main reason for me and many others is the price of this place! Oh man, everything is so cheap!! Thai restaurants usually charge pretty high for an entree here in Vegas and I love that this place keeps it to the minimum! 

I highly recommend this place. Don't even know why it took me this long to leave a review. I've been coming here since this location opened around my house! I have yet to try out their other locations.

If you are in a hurry DO NOT GO HERE. Service is horrible! Walked in & the place had a few full tables so we were excited to see that - must mean it's good. 

Heard 3 other tables asking for their check as they sat & waited too long for the waiter to bring it.Took over 10 minutes for us to get menus & drinks (soda & water). That's unacceptable. 

Tried the N.H. Style Pot Stickers as an appetizer. They were good. 

Had to ask for the Thai Spices as none were on the table. Had to get up from my meal to go ask for Salt. 

2 shrimp in the Chicken & Shrimps Silver Noodle. Come on Shrimp is in the name of the dish & you only get 2? And they were small on top of that. I've had bigger shrimp in Shrimp with Lobster Sauce at Chinese restaurants. 

Garlic and Pepper Chicken - rice was not cooked enough as it was hard & kept getting stuck in my lunch-mates teeth. It was also really greasy as her stomach was starting to turn as we walked out of the place.

Over all not impressed with the food or the service of this place.

Today was a fairly busy day for them...not like usual but I definitely love seeing that! My friend and I came in for a dine in and we were greeted instantly. Waters came to us right away. Although it took awhile for the servers to serve our food but the customer service here on the weekend is always better than weekday people. The weekday people always have that grumpy face and never smiled at us for some reason but the weekend people are very attentive and friendly. I was checked on very often to see if we were doing okay or if we needed anymore water. The food was delicious and worth waiting. Definitely recommend to come on the weekends! Great job guys.

Loving this new location near Jones and Warm Springs. It's about 5 mins away from my house.

New location is bigger, cleaner, but still offers the same great value and taste as the other Thai Style Noodle locations. 

Highly recommend!

Great simple place thats has a great vibe. The service is good and fast. Very polite. Not too many other restaurants in the area either so its good to have it here. Very clean inside. And everything looks new. I would come back again forsure

Awesome awesome awesome.  Great food food prices  excellent service.
Tried the thai noodle house 3, and it was terrible.  Rude service, ok food.  Don't go there go here!

1/7/17 update.
Food is still awesome, best pad thai beef in town.  We eat here at least 2x a week.  Service is impeccable (ask for nk pronounced "nock" I think my Thai is horrible, she is very professional and always gets the order exactly right).  Everyone I have brought here loves the food.  They will deliver also.  After trying around ten other thai restaurants I still believe this is the best food, service, and value in Vegas.

Ordered the duck fried rice and added crab and it was horrible. First off there was hardly any duck and to make matters worse, with every bite there was grit in my teeth from crab shell. Worst meal ever! It was like eating rice and sand! Will stick to Siamese Bistro!

I loooooove noodle house.. but I'm super disappointed. Ordered papaya salad, shrimp panang curry and Thai iced tea. Everything was amazing!!! But I when I got it home I couldn't believe how small the panang was. Even more juice would have been great
The food was good but the way they added heat was with big dried chili flakes so every bite of food would require me to spit out these little hard chunks.

I was super excited to see a location added right around the corner from my house. I loved every location including this one !  It's cheap and they give you great portions. the flavors are on point and the food comes out relatively fast. What makes this place different from other Thai restaurants is the different choices of soups almost like a create your own with the different noodle varieties. I would say it's one point below authentic but makes up for the price and portions !

I love this restaurant so much and I've been coming here for three years now. The only thing that has kept me coming is the server Nok; she is fantastic and genuinely kind. Each time we come we strike up lovely conversations and she always makes sure the food is made correctly and to our liking. The problem comes whenever we get a different server because the customer service here is mediocre and rude. All of the other servers are distant, cold, and talk poorly about their guests. We tip accordingly to the service we receive and when it's Nok we'll tip upwards of 40%, but as much as it pains me we have left no tip before because of how horrible the other servers are. 
I know that a two star rating is detrimental to a businesses rating but when there's only one good server in a restaurant, that's pretty off-putting regardless of how good the food is.

This is still a new place but seems like they are doing good. 

Food : excellent 
Love their noodle choices. The soup is flavorful. 

Price : Fair
Great price for the good quality and quantity. 

Service: average - low 
There are usually two waitresses working here. They are not mean or anything, but not great either. If they could bring a cup of water a little bit sooner, I would tip more though. Such a shame. 

Good place over all. I will come back.

I have never gone to eat at the restaurant, always order out. So I don't know about the service or atmosphere but the food is good. Ordered from here about three times now and every time I have loved the food. I think they are best at making the various soups. I always get Thom Ka Soup because I think this place makes it the best (even better than Lotus of Siam). Their spicy scale is 1-10 and they aren't messing around. It's great. 

My husband is less into thai but he gets their orange chicken or other entrees. For me they weren't that great. They weren't bad but they weren't anything extraordinary either. I think the noodles and the soups are where this place really shines. They are so flavorful. I recommend trying some of their soups and their chef specials (which have, so far, all been great). Don't forget your thai iced tea.

Good and Cheap place to get Thai food near Jones and 215. This is the fourth location in LV, but the quality of food is same as any other location. I usually stop by to get their ginger snapper or panang curry with salmon & avocado. My gf loves their beef and egg noddle soup which is also very delicious. The prices are very resonable for the amount of food you get. 

I would highly recommend stopping by this location.

Went here one day just trying new places it was nice, clean and prices were normal. I like spice in my food, told waiter that he kinda looked at me like he was a little confused. Food came was very bland good start needed more spice but nothing special.

Noodle house makes outstanding Thai food. The highlights include Thai iced tea, their pot stickers, tom yum soup, and all the curries (whether w/ or w/o coconut milk). I haven't ordered many other things though, they seem to make these the best. The restaurant isn't fancy or always packed, but I'm there for the great thai food. The spice level is accurate. I've gotten a consistent heat level every time. *Disclaimer - If you do order for pickup, there is typically an irate woman answering phone for all locations. Recently on a Saturday, she told me to hold several times etc; I said I'll order from somewhere else then, and she actually said "your choice" instead of "sorry, just a moment," for example. That was bothersome, but I eventually ordered. It's good asian grub. That's what counts!!

I go here about once a week and the food is consistent. I usually try something every time and I've had some hits and misses with the back page of the menu. The Tom yum noodles, Thai spicy noodles and kuah Kai I think are the best.

Noticed this spot several times as we hit up the joint next door: SOHO- DA BOMB DIGGITY!  We always by-passed this place due to it always appearing empty.  That usually speaks a lot.  Boy were we wrong to overlook the unassuming spot.

The decor is nice / clean lines / open feel.  The server was nice but totally home grown.  She was kind of all over the place.  I noticed there's A LOT of take out that's called into this place.  Nothing like Thai take out!  That's probably what drives this business to stay open.

The food was pleasantly good.  Not like your average Thai place where everything tastes good but doesn't look good.  They definitely plated with thought.  Things looked and tasted clean and refreshing.  

The pork beef jerky was amazing!  Not too chewy, packed a ton of flavor.  I was craving soup and the Tom Yum had the perfect balance of spice and citrus from the lemon grass.  It's a great detoxing soup and they were on point with the flavor.  

We also had the panang pork curry- level 3 which was perfect to taste the deep and rich flavor.  Any spicier you loose the complexity of the dish.  The chicken satay was chicken breast marinated in a curry coconut and not just sated like most places. I appreciate that extra step of LUV.  I wish the dipping sauce had more peanut punch though.  

The real Winner were the pot stickers.  Nice crunch and dressed up like it was on a date lol.  Looked and tasted like a dish from a nice sushi joint.  The spicy mayo and contrast of teriyaki drizzle and sesame seeds left you wanting a second date!  Lol

All and all it was a great experience.  Only 40.00 for 2 of us and we had a Diet Coke & Thai Coffee.  Surprised & Satisfied, can't ask for more than that!

LOVED this place.  We set out to get Boba tea next door at Perfect scoop, but decided to have lunch first. The place is quiet, clean and staff very friendly.  I had the pineapple curry with Shrimp & rice.. Delicious. They let you choose your heat level, I chose 5 and it was perfect.  My husband chose the Pineapple fried rice, cashew, chicken, He loved it and took half of it home, as the portion was very large.. Our waiter was kind, always filling our water glass, They have Tv's to watch too, I am glad we found this cute place..

I would drive here from Orange County, where I live, just to eat here. It was that good. I have been to Thailand twice for extended periods, and this food brought back some great memories. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My food arrived five minutes after I ordered, and the serving size was plentiful. I ordered the crispy pork over steamed rice. There were a couple sauces on the side - savory and sweet and sour. The pork was perfectly crispy and tender in the middle. I got a Thai iced tea, and since they were out of the regular small glasses, they gave me a huge mug, at the cost of the smaller size.

The best Thai food in Las Vegas. My husband has had every item on the menu. My go to items are red curry, pad Thai, fried rice and pot stickers. Some days I would just go here for dinner by myself. Service isn't amazing but the food is beyond good so it doesn't matter to me. I've been to every location in town but this one has the best interior.
Good prices, and portion sizes. The Pot stickers are amazing!

Despite all the little problems with some of the workers and how they made my food from time to time, overall the day shift people are the best. They have pretty good service or at least okay service; but lemme tell you about the food. They serve pretty bomb Thai food, I always find myself wanting to come back just because of their food. And I can't really give them a bad review because the service or some workers weren't that great (well I mean I can LOL) but I'm gonna be fair and rate them specifically on their food and their food is always so delicious (when I'm eating there) but if you order to go expect for the food to not be so perfect every time. My absolute favorites from here is the Tom yum soup, the roasted duck curry and the crab fried rice. OH and the fried shrimp over fried rice, all at level 6 spiciness. I've only gotten 1 out of 3 plates of fried shrimp over fried rice done correctly though so I don't try to order that one too often but I definitely do recommend this place it's one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to

They have no personality!  $15.30 just for veggies  egg rolls and add on's..
No matter how good the food is, i won't go back there again!

So I am upgrading my ratings for them.  I have been going their alot recently as the food in the EDR at work is getting to be near inedible.  Since I get off work around 9pmish.... They are still open and I can get take out for the next day.... And they are closer to my house then Archi's and they are cheaper. Always a good thing!! :)

Well I finally discovered a stir fried noodle dish that freaking rocks and I have never had this dish anywhere else. It's so freaking good!!! This is one stir fried noodle dish that they have been totally rocking it out on....Khua Kai. It's apparently a Chinese influenced dish lightly seasoned with soy sauce, oyster sauce and fish sauce. All I can say is that it's deliciousness! They basically cook the large flat rice noodles with egg and fried tofu in my case and place it like a large pancake over bean sprouts. They serve this with sweet chilli sauce. And I add some sambal for heat.  They almost seem to char the noodles and that charred flavor adds a little smoky flavor to this dish that's top notch!!! For me.... Perfect flavor and perfect texture on the noodles!!(5/5). :)

I'll be going there again soon to see if other dishes that I have not tried live up to this dish. :)
Love this place!! The flavors are sooo on point and the service is great. Definitely my go to place to grab awesome food when I'm in the neighborhood :)

Meh.  I got pad see ew and my husband of pork fried rice.  It seemed like something was missing. Salt ,msg ?! I don't know!!! The price was good for the portion size but it was just missing something. My husband felt the same way.

3 stars means average and that's what this place was.  I tried this place for the first time tonight.  It was just ok.  Nothing great but nothing bad.  It is very close to me so I might stop by again.

I really like their green chicken curry.. It has a lot of flavor and just some of the best Thai curry you can get in town. The potstickers are a great addition to any meal. The meat inside is delicious and the outside crispy as should be and they add delicious sauce to to the top of them. Check this place out it's really worth your trip!

Friendly staff everytime we eat here. its 2 minutes from home, quick service and real good thai food, duck fried rice is awesome, their pad thai is so delish even a 5 on a spicy scale is super spicy but its great for all spice loving eaters. if ur into thai iced coffee or thai iced tea i suggest u get a large. its only 50 cents more so its deff worth it. this is our regular to-go-to thai place. two thumbs up

This place is pretty good. Spacious place, good for large parties. I have been here a few times now, this is a great place to grab a quick lunch for decent prices. 

I have tried their duck fried rice, pineapple fried rice, their stir fried noodles, Tom yum noodles, spicy eggplant with rice... All were very good. My absolute favorite is their fried rice, their fried rice smells soooo good, no other places have fried rice that give off such a great stir fried smell. 

Service varies but overall decent. This place is cheaper than other Thai  places in the area.
Awesome tom kha soup, crab fried rice abs panang curry!  Friendly service and great value!!
It was my first time here last night and the food was very good! I loved the duck fried rice!
Really great take out noodles . Great flavor I usually get the duck pad Thai . Very tasty . Good price .
I got this delivered by Uber eats and its some of the best chicken noodle soup I've ever had. 10/10 will eat again.

I called in a delivery about an hour after they opened. Their menu online is easy to read and their website is simple and efficient. The girl on the phone and the delivery boy were both very nice and pleasant. I got the red curry- level 6- with shrimp, crab rangoons, and vegetarian egg rolls. The to-go container for the curry was a plastic tupperwear so nothing spilled! The fried items were perfectly crispy when they arrived to my door. The food was absolutely delicious! Fair portions and pricing. Everything I expect and love from Thai food.

Thai Style Noodle House has always caught my eye since regular at Liu same shopping mall. Thai food is definitely one of my favorites. So was excited about coming in for lunch and trying some of the food.

I ordered the Chicken and Shrimps Silver Noodles. I was in the mood for a nice hearty noodle dish for lunch. This dish delivered on point!!! They were not skimpy on the protein either chicken or shrimp, nice amount of vegetables from bean sprouts, carrots, cabbage, and the clear noodles again nice portion size. I really liked the sauce not really heavy gravy sauce but more light sauce. Not over powering. All the vegetables had nice crunch, al dente, and looked eye appealing just looking at it. It reasonable price. Menu is pretty diverse with lots of pictures just in case not sure.

The service was excellent. I got seated soon as I walked in. Never had empty glass. The decor is pretty interesting. It had bland look too it. Sure the walls are painted so nothing like cafeteria style. On one side of the walls there couple widescreen televisions. Other then that and one sculpture that sit on the counter. Odd. Yet they have modern look between the light fixtures above and the seats. If you walk in never think going into Thai restaurant. Good or bad? It all about the food for me. In Thai Style Noodle House case am FAN. No doubt plan on making it regular lunch spot for me and trying more of the menu.

The service was good and fast. I like the ambiance of the place very purple-like and fun. Very spacious when you visit inside. By far the cleanest Thai place I've ever visited. Food was good and good location especially I don't have to drive all the way to China town for their other location!

This restaurant is just down the block from my house and I finally had the chance to try it out.  The restaurant has a modern vibe very clean and the waiters are very attentive. 

I ordered the combo appetizers and the three companions (chicken)  everything was delicious.
Chicken was marinated just right, papaya salad has just the right acidity and very fresh. 

Will definitely come back again!

This place is amazing,  my family and I started off going to there other location on spring mountain,  then to the one on fort apache now this location is 2 minutes from my house.  Very clean and modern.  Staff very nice.  Food absolutely delicious! Fresh and hot every time. Highly recommend,  I saw people outside reading there menu I told them try it you will not be disappointed, so they walked in and sat down :)

Actually I want to give them zero star.  I ordered by phone  and repeated 4 times. No garlic in my food. The girl that picked up the phone said yes and ok no garlic. When I arrived there , there are garlic in my noodle. It's ok. I can wait for the new one. Instead of cooking me the new one , they just use the spoon took garlic out of my noodle. I asked her did u cook the new one ?  She said yes , it's the new one. How can she cook the new one in 1 min. I just asked for my money back and left. U made a mistake and all u have to do is cooking the new one. Don't be cheap and do like this. I'm really disappointed. It's used to be good restaurant. I always go get dinner over there. I don't know they change the owner or change the servers.  The service is getting worst.  Really disappointed.

Stopped in for lunch to give this spot √†nother try.  I had come once before when it was a different Thai place and it was just okay, nothing great.  My sister comes regularly and said it's really good, so decided to give it another shot.

I got the shrimp and avocado curry with brown rice, so good!  My two friends also got a curry dish and enjoyed it but said mine was the best.  It was really tasty and I like the shrimp and avocado combination which is a different curry combo that I haven't seen in other places.  I usually do chicken or beef but this one caught my eye.  Will def come back as it was very yummy and reasonably priced.

I waited for over twenty minutes and nothing was being served so I think the waiter forgot to put my order in! He was more intent on checking his phone in the corner than he was taking care of his customers! Won't go back!

Not a good experience at all... I ordered the papaya salad Laos style and they charged a dollar extra and didn't tell me that it was extra when I ordered, I have NEVER been charged extra at a Thai restaurant for having it made Laos style.  Also, the portion size was EXTREMELY small. The order was the size of a small side item. For $9 you would expect to get a decent size plate.  I will never come to this establishment again.  Next time I will travel the distance and go to my favorite place in Chinatown. Very disappointed with this place!

Comfortable chairs and booths, nice TV locations which show sports and cartoons. Prices are very fair for Thai cuisine and there is always ample seating when I come here. They are occasionally out of certain items on the menu but for me it hasn't been a common occurrence.

This is a small Thai place with a BIG flavors. I found this place over 6 years ago at their first location (Spring Mtn and Wynn) and could not be happier when they finally opened one in my neighborhood. Great authentic taste, great prices, quick great service and generous portion. 

Recap of what we had this time:
Appetizer: Crispy Calamari $6.75. Delicious crispy fresh calamari. It's crispy on the outside and chewy fresh on the inside. Comes with hot and sweet sauce. 
Entree: 
- Green Curry Pork $7.25 - my husband thinks this place has the best green curry in town. Couple of my co-workers second that statement as well. One thing to be aware of: their spicy level is not the same like other Thai joint. If you do not like spicy, try to level it one or two down and you can always add more spice later on. We ordered spicy level #5. Their curry has a perfect balance of spicy anda little bit of sweetness from the coconut milk. Must try! 
- Seafood Tom Yum with Flat Rice Noodle spicy level #7-  $8.95. You can pick your own noodles: thin rice noodles, flat rice noodles, yellow egg noodles or vermicelli. This is a SPICY soup. Perfect for winter. It'll warm your body up. 
- Pad See Euw $7.25. Generous portion for the price. 
- Crispy Noodles with Seafood & Wonton (their Chef's special menu) $8.95. I recommended this dish to try, especially if you like crispy noodles. 
- Tom Kha (coconut milk soup with seafood) $7.25. If you like thai style soup but not on the sour side (tom yum), then this would be a perfect one to try. 

Desert: mango sticky rice $4.25. My favorite desert! 

We had to take some home due to their generous portion. Recommended place to go when you crave Thai food. If you pay with yelp, you'll get some cash back too!

First of all $35 for an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert... can't beat the prices. No wait, went on an off time on a Monday. We ordered the yellow curry, pad thai, calamari, and Tom yum. The yellow curry, like everyone says, was freaking delicious. It tastes authentic and reminds me of when I went to south Thailand. Be careful of the spiciness though! We ordered 3s and 4s and it was a little much for me. The calamari was delicious, very crunchy and soft on the inside, would definitely recommend. I'd say the pad Thai was above average, not the best I've had but pretty good. We also ordered the sticky rice with mango, it was delicious and came in the shape of a cute little heart.

Update: ordered pick up and the lady on the phone was rude af! Started with her asking "which location are you ordering from?? I need to here it from you! We have 4 locations!" Then just straight monotone and no help to my questions. Like are you just a lonely lady with a stick up her butt 24/7?? Go work at a place that requires no customer service like a janitor or something.

Just got my food. Ordered a 0 for spicy. Butgot like a 3... wtf


I've been to this location twice. Ordered the same thing both times. 1 to go and for dine in. The portion for the pad Thai was the same. The portion for the deep fried calamari is half of what it looks like on the menu. The pad see-eu was a huge difference. When I got it to go, my box was filled. When I received my food for dine in, the portion was only half of what I go for dine in. It only took up half the plate. Keep in mind, the box is a lot bigger than than plate. 

Overall, the food is good. Just keep in mind that the portions here are inconsistent. I'll give it a 3 for now
This place is great. Our office orders from here often. Today we all came here for lunch to change up our day. Its a great place for delivery and ear in. Yum!!!!!!!

Where ever I feel like eating a quick,tasty, cheap meal, I come here. My favorite dish is the duck noodle soup with vermicelli. Another one of my favorite dishes is the avocado Panang with salmon. Sometimes the Salmon is over cooked. I guess it depends which cook is back there for the night. 
Papaya salad is also good. I get the Laos style. It's more spicy and potent in flavor! But also... It depends which chef is making it. It's a little inconsistent. 
If your looking for a cheap, tasty Thai meal Thai style noodle house is the place to go!

I didn't pay attention to the address, so not sure if this is the right restaurant since there are other restaurants with the same name. Anyways, nothing too special here if you've eaten at other Thai restaurants. I do want to comment on their Pad Thai --it's really delicious. I've had many other Pad Thai from various Thai restaurants, and this one is absolutely delicious. I highly recommend you eat here and try it.

Sa wat dee - First timer to Thai Style Noodle House and would come back. Pleasant service and good lunch specials. I tried the pad si ew with chicken which you can get with spicy level 1-10. I chose 7 which was a good amount of heat but no tears. Overall good entree, plenty of Chinese broccoli and they didn't skimp on the chunks of chicken. The sauce was just right, not dry and overly saucy. 4/5 for my meal.

There were other items I would like to try on the menu like the crab fried rice or the shrimp over fried rice. There were also plenty of noodle options. Khorb Kuhn Maak!

This is my second time coming to this location. The restaurant is always empty which is somewhat a plus for people who just wanna get in and out. I give 3 stars for the customer service. The other two stars are for my experience and inconsistency. Wait time for the food is never more than 10-15 minutes which is great, however the pictures on the menu are somewhat misleading. I ordered their deep fried calamari twice and both times the portions were really small compared to the picture they have on the menu. There's only 10 tiny pieces of calamari for $6.75. I could get triple the portion for just a couple bucks more elsewhere.

Upon arrival, My boyfriend and I were seated in a booth. The booth that we were seated in was kind of uncomfortable for me bc my seat seemed to be broken? It felt as if I was sliding off my seat the whole time. But it was fine.

Aside from that, their pad Thai ($7.25) and pad see-eu ($7.25) is amazing. Very tasty, and I love how you can customize the level of spice to each dish. The portion is perfect for sharing also.

In conclusion, this place has good Thai food for  decent prices.

I was here couple time for lunch, both times were busy. The food is not bad compare to spring mountain location. We went here for dinner time, the food was way better. Chicken mint, pai tai, pai see ew, and chicken satay were awesome. We thought we have to take them go, but they all gone. The quality and quantity are great. During dinner time is not busy like lunch time. It was quite nice and we enjoyed it a lot with thunder storm and lightning outside. Definitely we will go there dinner again.

The foods amazing and comes out fast. Overall the menu is really affordable. The restaurant is nice and comfortable, a great place for a date or to go out and eat with some friends. The people are nice and answer any questions you have. If you call in to make a order it's made fast and fresh. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and definitely the best Thai restaurant here.
I love this place!  Great food! Great staff!  Great price!  Always stop in when I'm in the area.  I love the Thai Tea.

I got the Pad Thai because I like to use it as a comparison plate that all Thai places have. Their Pad Thai was flavorful, fresh and one of the best plates I've ever had. Definitely as good or better as Archi's or Pink Kaow. The portion size was big too. Very filling.

The service was very good for lunch time and the prices are awesome. There is no lunch special because their regular prices beat most lunch specials. 

Overall the experience was very nice and that fact that all of it was just $7 is incredible. Amazing place I'll be back to weekly for lunch.
The best thai food in vegas!  My favorite are the shrimp pad thai and duck noodle soup.  Always fast and polite service!

Those of us that call southwest Las Vegas home know that the Thai Style Noodle House has been a number of different places over the years... But this time I think we have found something that will stick.  I am a huge Thai food fan, and can report that this place meets all the standards.  They offer delivery, takeout and have improved the dinning room to make it so that you don't want to just get it to go. So give this place a try!

Panang shrimp is good as well as the BBQ wonton soup but the Duck noodle soup wasnt good at all. Prices are cheap cause portions are small. 

As for service, it sucks. I told the server nicely that I didn't like the duck noodle soup  she gave me a nasty look.

I'm not coming back here. So many other Thai/noodle places around town that's so much better.

Awesome service!
Went here for a friend's bday and I had a good experience. We were a group of ten and we came around 7-8ish for dinner. Their staff is so accommodating and polite. Our servers always made sure our drinks were topped off and they constantly checked up on us to see how we were doing. The food was really good too!

From reading the low reviews from this place and people complaining about the decor I'm wondering what that has to do with food?

Although I'm not Thai, I grew up in Thailand for 15 years. I think people eating here need to remember that this place is called noodle house. That's means they're known for their noodles. This place is the closest I can get to actual Thai street noodles. Although the service could be better, I don't go to a restaurant based on what it looks like or based on the service. I go based on the food and this place hits the mark for me. One of my favorite places to go for Thai noodle soups. 

On another note, Thai noodle soups are also very hard to find here in the US. You can find pho anywhere but, for some reason it's hard to find a decent bowl of Thai noodles. Like I said before, this place gets as close as I can get to the actual thing.

This place is my go to Thai Restaurant in Blue Diamond !!!! They have the finest noodles at an affordable price and their customer service is on point. The restaurant itself is super clean, stylish and built with t.v. entertainment. 

Great food-- will definitely be a regular here. :)

My new favorite Thai spot. Everything I had here was amazing.
Found this place through Yelp. (Of course.)
Came here for Saturday dinner at 8 pm. It was not that busy so there was no wait to be seated in this nice comfortable booth.
There were two waitresses working that night and they both waited on us. They were both very nice and attentive.
Their chicken satay had very strong curry flavor but not spicy. I loved it. The peanuts sauce was not just sweet but it had a little spicy taste because the sauce was in some kind of spicy oil. It was good.
Seafood Wonton soup was nice and flavorful. Came with a lot of rice noodles. It's nice  you can pick noodles from four different kinds. 
I ordered my red curry spice level 7. A bit spicier than regular spicy curry. Usually, they never get it right. I often have to send my curry back to put more spice in. Wow. They got it right. It was the perfect spice level 7 taste. I enjoyed my curry very much. Chicken was tender. Lots of veggies in it. 
I saw two Thai customers eating at this place. (I saw them speaking in Thai with the waitresses.) I figure that means the food here is authentic. I don't think I ever saw Tai people eating at other Thai places. Usually I see a lot of Indian people at Thai restaurants lately. 
This place definitely is my new fave. Good dessert shop is right next door after the meal!! I liked it here better than Archi's.

We love this place. This is my families go to place for thai food. Customer service is ok. Pad thai. Pad seeu, fried chicken over fried rice, and crispy noodle seafood combination is what we always order. We just recently moved to las vegas and weve eaten here almost every week!

I am very picky with Pad Thai. Many places don't do it well. This place had amazing Pad Thai and did it correctly! Friendly staff with great Chicken Pad Thai! I highly recommend it to anyone! I don't usually eat other food from Thai Restaurants but tried a couple of other things and was pleasantly surprised. Try it out, you won't be disappointed.

VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTED! I drop by for quick lunch with wifey before picking up the kids from school, but ended up with only me had lunch while she watched and her food never came out. And when she asked the waitress she gives bad attitude saying food coming and different chef for different dishes. I've ordered level 6 spiciness for stir fried noodle, but it came out zero spicy level. It took me 15 mins to finish, and wife noodle soup never came out. We just asked for our check plus they over charged me. And once again more excuses for never deliver wife's noodle soup. So only me had lunch. TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE!!! I only give 1 star otherwise it won't post.

This review just solid on the food I ordered. The food is good. Ordered 3 companion. Sticky rice was undercooked. But the pork and papaya salad goes with it so yummy. Also I like their tomyum soup as well. Flavorful. Big bowl with noodles. Service was ok.

This was my first time trying the Thai Style Noodle House on Jones and Warm Springs. You can find Thai Style Noodle House on the southwest corner and right behind the Lucky's Lounge. 

We saw the good reviews on Yelp! and decided to give it a shot.

Wow! What a gem!

Things I like-

- Ordered the Tom Yum soup with vermicelli noodles ($6.95), the chicken pad see ew($6.95), and the BBQ chicken fried rice (also $6.95) Portions were very healthy for the price point and everything tasted so yummy!
- the chicken pad see ew almost had a subtle sweetness to its flavoring that made the dish very tasty! Not overpowering, but still noticeable ...it was just right! :)
- the chicken fried rice was very tasty and the rice was soft and fluffy!
- the tom yum was served in a HUGE bowl and this was the first time I've had it served to me in town with the vermicelli noodles. So tasty and full of flavor!
- service was friendly and competent. 
- the actual restaurant itself is very spacious and is tastefully decorated. Lots of purple and pink!

Things I did not like-

- the soft drinks, once again, served in a can ($1.50 each). Argh! 

Aside from the whole soda in a can thing, I love this place and will definitely be back on numerous occasions! Great food, in healthy portions, at a reasonable price! This place is somewhere you definitely want to make a point to check out if you appreciate some good Thai food!

4.5 stars!

First time trying here and it was a good experience. The portions and price are fair and the food tastes good ! I'm not really sure why everyone is having such a bad experience at this location as the server was very nice and attentive towards us. The only thing was that the Spicy Level wasn't consistent with both dishes. Other then that I'd recommend this place

First time here and definitely will be coming back! Good variety of dishes on the menu and for reasonable prices. We ordered yellow curry, duck fried rice, crab Rangoon and pad Thai and they were all delicious. Glad to find a Thai place close by that isn't overpriced.

Stopped in for lunch and it's definitely a decent spot to eat if you're coming in and out. The service was fast and they check on you a lot. I ordered a noodle soup. It was soy base with vegetables, chicken and seafood. My kind of style in food. I also ordered the pot stickers. Loved the presentation; they had a sauce drizzled on top. Noodle bowl which was large and pot stickers (6 count) was $15.
I had the WORST Larb salad ever at this restaurant it smelled like cat food and the meat was grey

At 6:30pm, I decided to try this place out since it was just a couple of doors down from the phone repair shop where my daughter was having her iPhone repaired. The place was empty which said plenty to me, but the menu looked alright. The restaurant was extremely sterile and clean. We chose a booth and sat down. When I told the lady we needed a few more moments to order our food, she continued to stand at the table so I felt slightly rushed. I ordered a sliced beef noodle soup with wide rice noodles, a pad see ew, and a basil chicken and rice to split with my daugher. She also ordered a thai tea. I asked to keep a menu so that I could order a to-go item to take home and the server actually told me he needed it back so that was that. The tea came up right away and my daughter commented that it mostly tasted like milk and sugar. The beef noodle soup came up next and was no more than mediocre. The beef sliced seemed rubbery and lacked flavor. The basil chicken was alright, but it the vegetables were extremely undercooked...more like slightly warmed up, but still raw. The noodles in the pad see ew were all stuck together so I packed it up and hope my boyfriend will eat it, or maybe the dogs. Needless to say I won't be returning.
Not bad for the price. Had the pad Thai and chicken skewers. Pad Thai was pretty good but skewers a little on the dry side. Very fast service.

You get what you pay for. I got the cashew chicken and the coconut soup. I could not eat the soup it was so salty. They made no effort to correct it. The cashew chicken has so much pineapple and corn that I maybe had half of an edible meal.
I enjoyed the food but it was so quiet that it ruined my time eating. The waiter and waitress were rude but I could have came in on a bad day. It made the atmosphere feel weird and awkward.

I have never felt inclined to leave a review on Yelp until now. Now I must admit that I wasn't expecting too much, but Yelp's good reviews and my family's overwhelming hunger led me here. I found this to be an extremely well done example of relatively cheap but delicious Thai restaurant. I ordered Pineapple fried rice with chicken, which was absolutely delicious. The chicken and egg were a perfect combination with the fried rice and the pineapple added to the overall flavor. We also ordered Red curry, Spicy Eggplant Rice plate, and Pad See-eu, all of which were absolutely delicious. At the end we had Mango Sweet Sticky Rice which tasted like Kheer, an Indian sweet rice pudding, with mangoes, but had its own unique texture giving it a brilliant taste.

I visited Thai Style Noodle House for the first time and have to say I was disappointed.  I asked about the Garlic and Pepper dish and was told by the staff that it was really good.  I ordered it with shrimp to go.  Upon arriving home and unpacking the meal, I found a small portion of five small shrimp and canned mushrooms. I choose Asian foods because I enjoy fresh vegetables in my prepared dishes.  The use of canned veggies screams of low quality and little care in preparation.  My expectation was a fresh prepared meal.  I would have rather had them suggest a more popular dish.  It was nothing even close to authentic.  I giess I should have known by the sign Thai Style.  All I can say is not even close.

The service here is non existent. I walked to the back where the "hostess stand" was and asked if we seated ourselves, to which the two girls said nothing, then one of the girls grabbed two menus and walked us to a table. We sat for a good 10 minutes without being acknowledged. I called over one of the girls to ask for water and to place my order. I ordered the chicken yellow curry and spicy Thai basil both with brown rice. The yellow curry had a good consistency and came with white meat chicken while the Thai basil came with dark meat which was low quality. Both dishes were minimal in size and came with a big scoop of rice and a small amount of the actual dish. 

The prices here are considerably lower than most Thai restaurants but the quality and value is about the same as an average neighborhood Thai restaurant. They do offer brown rice so I may come back if I am in the neighborhood and want a quick straight forward meal.

I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. I've been here probably 20 times. I would have to give their flavor rating maybe a 4.0 or 4.5 on flavor. But the thing that makes me choose 5 stars, is that everything on the menu is good! I think there's only been one order out of many which I didn't care too much for. But it was a new dish to me, and I didn't want to give it negative points on something that I can't fairly judge.

I love the pad thai. The avocado salmon curry is yummy. The panang curry is great. The yellow curry is delicious.

Even my coworkers who aren't very adventurous love this place too. I'm not sure how that worked out, considering that my taste buds tend to be a bit more eclectic.

I usually get takeout from this location. The food is really good I usually order the Pad Thai spice level 8 or 9 which they never make it spicy it's usually a level 5 and they even asked me are you sure you wanted that spicy I'm like yes which is not. You could also tell by the color and smell it's not spicy. However the customer service is horrible. I told the lady my noodles won't even spicy and she just threw a thing of chili flakes at me. You would think okay since it's not spicy all we make your dish now you basically just told me to get out by throwing the hot chili flakes.

First time eating here. Food was quickly made and was delicious. We ordered Chicken Satay and Shrimp Rolls for appetizers. We also had Chicken Pad See-eu, Thai Fried Rice, Fried Chicken over Fried Rice and the Three Companion Pork. All were reasonably priced and were good portions. Will definitely come back!

My boyfriend and I tried this place out since we just recently moved to this side of town. We haven't had Thai food on this side of town and I've been craving some spicy pad Thai noodles! Stumbled upon this little spot all thanks to Yelp! 

We quickly took our seats and our drink orders were ordered almost instantly. The Thai tea was okay, I've had better. I ordered spicy chicken pad Thai. The portion sizes were fairly large. Everything was fresh! My boyfriend ordered the beef soup with rice noodles and he enjoyed every last sip of it. 

Service was quick and the servers were super attentive. Made sure they checked up on us as well as the other customers in the restaurant fairly often. 

As far as cleanliness, they get an A+! If you could guess by now... I'm HUGE on cleanliness. You can tell the owners and workers take the time out to clean each individual booth thoroughly. 

Happy to say that I think I have finally found my "go-to" Thai food restaurant!
Love the calamari, but the service sucked.  Guy threw the menus down and walked away and we needed more sauce for the cal and I had to go to the front and ask for it.  The Thai tea was great

I used to come here often in the past. I really enjoyed the food and the restaurant provided good service. Recently, however, the waitresses are slow, they place orders on the wrong table, and they act unfriendly and unhappy. Instead of greeting people at the door they are too busy talking to each other. The food takes forever to come out.  I won't be coming by anytime soon. Best of luck to this business.

I frequent the S. Jones location.  It is by far my favorite Thai spot!  The service is fast and friendly.  The food never disappoints.  We just found out they deliver and that is a huge bonus for me!  The Yellow Curry is ahhh-mazing!  A few other top choices are N.H. Style Pot Stickers and the BBQ Pork and Chinese Sausage Fried Rice!!  Their Pad Thai is another favorite. Their prices are VERY affordable and the establishment is clean.

I really liked the Thai style noodle house on fortapache and was really excited when I found out they had one closer to home. At first glance I thought the new place looked really cool. Then after taking a seat I realized the atmosphere was very strange. The space felt really big and empty even though there were others eating in the restaurant. The servers were nice, but not very attentive. The food was good, for the price. I had the three companion. The chicken was decent, portion wasn't satisfying, though. The sticky rice was nice and hot. The som tum was alright. Albeit The decor is still "cool",  but I rather drive the extra ten minutes to the other location where the atmosphere makes me feel like I'm out eating rather than the feeling of eating alone at home. However, I would still come back to this location of I'm short on time. It's not bad, not great. It's good. 3.5 stars.

The decor isnt what I expected from a Thai restaurant but it's cute and spacious. We havent had to wait long to be seated either. The staff is sweet and friendly. The food comes out rather quickly. Their pad see ew is one of my favorites. I like that their steamed rice is a good portion and is a lot bigger than the portions I usually get from other Asian restaurants. Their fried chicken over fried rice is good too!

When I'm craving Thai food and want to go somewhere nearby this is my first stop. Overall the food is good, but nothing special. The service can be better, because I sometimes have to sit and wait for a server to approach me.

So, I'm disappointed. 

For me, one of the most beautiful things about living in this town is the accessibility to good food and even better service at all price points at the drop of a hat. 

AMAZING restaurants with little to no wait...EVER. I started going to Thai Style Noodle house a few years ago at the Ft. Apache location. They have amazing food, at great prices...it was my "go to" for takeout dinners. 

To my pleasant surprise, I found this location near my work. I frequent Soho House and Scoop in the same strip mall (both of which are spectacular). 

So let's get some perspective. My husband and I are in our mid 30's. Both professionals, and eat out 6 nights a week...solid. We don't cook. We go to Thai, Japanese, Chinese, Italian, American, Indian...you name it, we like it. We are true foodies. 

To be fair, the food/price balance here is excellent. I've never had anything but delicious food from the Ft. Apache location. 

But this location.  Ugh. 

We order from this place (from the office) on average once every 2 weeks.  I get the same thing for lunch every time. Every time, I get pad see ew with a level 3 out of 10 spice.   Side note: I put sriracha on my foods, I get the hot salsa at Mexican restaurants...I'm good with spice. But at lunch, with the pad see ew, I get a 3 because I don't want the spice to take anything away from the delicious flavor of the noodles themselves. 

Sometimes I'm sad and I can't taste any of the spice. I figure, it's ok. Still delicious. 

But today...today we ordered the same. When I opened the box, I knew there was a problem. I could see red everywhere. Every single bite I loaded on my fork had visibly 10-15 specks of red chili flakes.  I took 3 bites and was literally sweating. SWEATING!!  My pregnant coworker who can't get enough spice had ordered a level 5 out of 10 and couldn't even put down 3 bites!!  

We called, politely explaining that the food was nearly inedible and guess what we got??? 

ATTITUDE!  

We were told "WELL IM NOT CREDITING YOU UNLESS YOU BRING BACK THE UNEATEN FOOD". Wow??  Who asked for a refund?  We want lunch. 

Then when we said "ok, we can bring it back" we got a lecture about spice. 

Anyways....

When we walk in, we get eye rolling from the young man working the counter. And he proceeds to tell us (literally, no exaggeration) "WE CAN NOT CONTROL THE SPICE. IT DEPEND ON THE CHILLI". 

Are you EFFING kidding?  Have I not eaten Thai food a thousand times?!  Then he refuses to make the food with any spice. 

I've never met a ruder person. To be so rude and diva-like to two women who just want some edible lunch!!  

I won't be coming back. I guess that's why this place is always empty. Lol. 

I used to feel bad and always suggest it to people. No more!!!  Stay away!!!  

There are a dozen other Thai restaurants in a 5 mile radius. Go elsewhere!!  

To management or the owner, take note that customer service MEANS something. And you've lost a customer (and anyone I can tell).

This is by far the best Thai place in Vegas that I've eaten so far, especially for the price - quantity ratio. The pad Thai I ordered today was a very generous plate that other Thai places would consider dinner price and would charge $10+ for. Thai Style Noodle House only charges $6.95! (Shrimp only 7.95). Noodles were perfect spice level, perfect texture and tagged delicious. As a big fan of Thai food, spicy food, and large portions, would definitely recommend this place! Additionally, service was quick and there is plenty of variety on the menu. Two reasonably large dishes would only put your bill around $15.00-$20.00, easily double the value of most restaurants nowadays.

Nice, clean restaurant. Very good service, nice people. This is the first Thai food I've tried since coming back from visiting Thailand. The food here was at least as good or better than any food I had in Thailand. Everything tasted great. It was all very fresh. I had duck fried rice, pad thai, orange chicken and sweet sticky rice with ice cream. This is definitely a place I will come to again. Can't wait to try more of their dishes. They do an excellent job.

First impressions: I immediately noticed the peculiar Barney-color purple paint and grey tufted booth seating. Along the far left wall, there are three more booths that offer more privacy -- kind of like having your own VIP section. A regal wooden paneling envelops one side of the restaurant dotted with white tufted single chairs. I know they're trying to look modern, but for me, it comes off disjointed and more of a beauty salon look... but hey, at least it's clean! 

Food: Of course, my bf ordered the chicken yellow curry. His review of his dish is that they skimped on the chicken and used sweet potatoes instead of regular ones. Fair enough. I had their pad see ewe with tofu. They give you the option of soft or fried, so I went with the latter. Let me just say, this is probably one of the best pad see ewes I've had! (Yeah, really!) It was just the right portion and they sprinkle it with some type of fried garlic on top. Price-wise, they're a little bit cheaper than comparable Thai places, so I was quite surprised. 

Service was good. It could have been better considering there was literally only one other table besides us there, but the workers seem to be on their own breaks? Not sure, but I'd definitely wouldn't rule them out. We'll be back!

PS -- There are 4 locations in Vegas (Jones, Rampart, Fort Apache, and Chinatown.)

Horrible customer service, terrible food, and what happened after I left the place gave me a sour taste. 

At first they came to us immediately asking to take our order but I said that we needed a couple more minutes. This turned into 20 minutes. No one came back. I had to flag someone down just to take our order.

Next, they did not even check up on us if we needed anything else. (Napkins, refill, if we are doing okay, etc.). The food was bland and was horribly made. Would not recommend. I don't know how this place is getting 5 stars!!

Since no one came by at all I had to go up and find somebody just to get my check. The weirdest part is that this place was nowhere near busy! So why didn't they check up on their customers? Why do I have to walk from my table all the way to the counter just to ask for someone to take our order, get us items, and our check? 

When I left this place, the server FOUND ME ON FACEBOOK AND MESSAGED ME. He sent me a photo of the receipt and asked if I had put down my real signature. SO INTRUSIVE!!!!!  He also started the sentence when he messaged me with "I know it's very intrusive." UH yeah, I felt so uncomfortable from just this alone. 

I would have been open to trying the place again if the staff did not try to message me on Facebook. That is not professional at all.

I recently moved here from LA and I have asked every Thai or Laos person where I can find authentic Thai boat noodles, oh I should add I am Laos and have had authentic Thai and Laos food from the motherland. Anyways, to my disappointment no one could give me a definite answer to replenish my craving. Until I stumbled upon this quaint little establishment. For the record, I am only reviewing their Thai boat noodles because I can eat everything else on the menu any time I want. Overall it was pretty good and satisfied my craving. I am glad it's near my house and was not over priced like most Asian spots s in SW and MTN edge. This Asian spots charge almost $10.00 for sub par Pho. Rip off! I recommend you try this dish if you haven't.
I like this place has all the dishes i like and the flavor is all there. Lately, the portion size has becoming smaller which my husband is not pleased with. But still a good place to eat.

This place is close to my house and the food is fairly tasty for the price. I would go in for lunch or dinner a few times a month and never had a bad experience until today. I placed a to go order for Tom Yum Soup with egg noodles. The guy taking my order repeated the order back to me and stated egg noodles. When I got home, there were no egg noodles. I really wanted the noodles, so I drove back to the restaurant.
