Instead of apologizing or getting me egg noodles, the guy pulls the ticket for the order to show me there were no egg noodles on it and that it was my fault. I told him he stated egg noodles when he repeated order but he said no. He said if I wanted egg noodles, I would have to pay 1.50. At this point, it wasn't about the additional cost, but the lack of customer service. I walked out. I won't be going back there again. I regret giving a tip for my to go order.

Good place for an inexpensive and tasty Thai fix. Get takeout here at least once a month. The beef combination soup and chicken pad Thai are delicious. Total of 4 stars for the shrimp dishes and chicken larb which is bland.
Finally a good Thai place on this side of town, and it's cheap! We've been eating here every day and definitely not stopping anytime soon!

I went here yesterday with my family to try the restaurant.  Unfortunately I wasn't able to try the food because of the horrible and rude server that started to wait on us.  She didn't smile and basically acted like we were pissing her off by being there.  We asked for beverages a few minutes after she threw the menus down.  She forgot one of the beverages so I asked her about it.  The look on her face was of utter disgust.  I saw her talk to a co-worker obviously complaining about us because she was pointing at us.  She came back and threw down some plates and silverware.  She was the rudest server I have ever encountered in Vegas.  I have been in the food and beverage field for decades.  I asked for the manager and she laughed and said "no manager".  My mom was pretty upset at the service so far so all 6 of us left.  We ended up going to a Chinese fusion restaurant several doors down from your restaurant and had phenomenal service.  Whoever owns this business should train your servers to actually be polite.  I eat out several times a week and you just lost my and my family's business.

Just moved to Vegas and didn't want to drive all the way to Spring Mountain road to find a Thai place to eat at.  I found this little place on a Saturday night.  It wasn't too busy when I got in so I got a table right away.

I ordered a rad-na beef, 0 spicy and substituted american broccoli.  My order came out exactly as I wanted, and tasted exactly what I wanted it too.  The only thing was (in a good way)... HOLY PORTION SIZE.  I'm used to eating rad-na on plate at other thai places- but here, they give you a Pho bowl, and its sauce and portions are generous, if not intimidating.  Was good to the last bite.  

I think this place is a chain.  But this place was good for me and the pricing too.  I love trying out new places, so don't know if I'll be back, but its a definite recommend!

This space where Thai Style Noodle House #4 currently is located, used to be another Thai place that had weird textured chicken.  However, this regime served food that is nothing like the predecessor. 

I met my colleagues here for lunch and the prices are great!  One colleague ordered Crab fried rice ($7.95) while the other ordered beef penang curry (6.95).  I ordered the duck curry ($8.25) and Thai iced tea.  The spice scale is from 1 thru 10.  I ordered a 5 but tasted more like a 7.  However, the duck curry was spot on.  The curry was nice and thick, with small chunks of pineapple, bell pepper, and the right amount of basil.  The slices of duck were satisfactory.  This was good for 2 meals.  

On top of the food being delicious, this spot is a 5 minute drive from our workplace.  I am a fan, and will be coming back to get my Thai food cravings.
This place is a hidden gem. The decor is modern and sleek. The food was good and the prices were amazing. Definitely will be going back. The silver noodle soup was just what I needed on a cold night.

When it comes to Thai food, I found both Archis or a place like Pan Asian to be superior. Actually, even the Thai Style Noodle House in Chinatown somehow sports better tasting food and portion size. That being said, they do offer low prices and a good selection. But my Pad Thai wasn't very tasty at all. Too bad, as this place is literally a 1 minute drive away for me.

It was pretty good, but it wasn't spicy at all. It needed a bit more seasoning and the chicken, beef, shrimp they all tasted the same it was hard to differentiate with was which since they all tasted the same. Definitely love the Thai tea though!

here today and for the first time in over 5 yrs I've been dining here that I was told I could not bring outside drink in which happens to be my kids bottle water. So instead of giving me a heads up for the next time. She ( server) pretty much told me that the owner does not want the drink in her store and that it would need to be taken outside immediately. Which pretty much made it easy for me to just get up and leave the store and never will I return to this location. 
What a bummer for them. I already know how hard it is to get customers in to my business let alone kicking them out because of a bottle water  they brought and was never warned before . 
Oh well they just lost $50 bucks I was gonna spend today plus my future $100's of dollars.

The food is good but the service was not good at all. I asked for a lemon and they gave me a rind with nothing on it. The curry was really good. It even made up for the fact that they blatantly ignored my empty glass my whole meal.

I've been on a Thai binge. Definition of Thai binge.. if you go without Thai for more than three days you get a hangry haaaaangry Queennie. 

I liked that this place used Chinese broccoli and not broccoli broccoli in their pad see ewe. And I loved the prices for their portion sizes. 

Their service was great. And that's honestly all this hungry thai filled girl needs in a restaurant. 
Short and sweet, great food at good prices with great service! 

Defs will be back for more!

The restaurant is very cute and clean looking. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I ordered the pineapple fried rice since that is my Thai go-to dish I use to compare restaurants. It was good- the chili sauce was amazing. I will definitely be coming back and exploring more of the menu here!

Loved it!!! My favorite was the Panang shrimp with avocado. So creamy, flavorful, and just had the right amount of spice to keep your mouth watering for more. It was so good with white rice  I highly recommend the duck fried rice and the Pad Thai as well. So yummy! The place is clean and has a modern decor. Price wise, decently affordable. Will definitely come back again

OMG. We are from out of town, southern California to be exact. We live close to a bunch of southeast Asian communities and I have to say this is one of the best Thai places I've been to. I ordered the Duck Noodle soup, papya salad mild, and spicy basil fried rice at spicy level 9. I am very particular about my noodle broth because I own and make my own noodle soup at my restaurant and it's really one of the best I've had. The papaya salad was nice and sour and the spicy fried rice was delish. If you haven't tried this little gem please do so, I highly recommend. And the prices are sooooo reasonable for the quality of food!

We ordered from uber eats bc we were in the mood for good Thai. 

This was gross and they got our order wrong.

Great price. Good service. Nice portions and  delicious Thai food in southwest area. 

This location is nice and cleaned with beautiful color purple and grey interior. Feel so classy! 

I have been coming to this location about 3-4 times so far but never had a chance to write about them. 

There were only 2 servers during my dinner visit (around 6:30-7pm) and their phone kept ringing for to go ordered non stop but they made it through! 

As soon as I placed my order. I noticed a large amount of to go ordering about 10-15 boxes on their counter and I thought to myself... Oh "O"! 

I have to say.. They did a great job! My cup of water still filled, more napkins coming  and they still got time to checking on our table and other guests.  

Bathroom was cleaned and all equipped! What else I could asking for!?? I'm not a picky yelper anyway. 

Definitely will be back.

My go to Thai place when I'm craving that yummy Thai food at home. You can't beat the pricing at this place!! I love how everything tastes. My favorite is the tom yum and the pineapple fried rice. The portion of everything is pretty big! Whenever I have went there is never a wait. The flavor is always consistent. The service is nice. They also do takeout if you're within two miles of the restaurant!

I LOVE this place. I stumbled upon it and I am so happy I did. I have visited this place a couple different times and every time the food is very good and fresh and the service is quick. 

Gluten Free: They do not have a gf menu, but they are very accommodating. They are happy to make any of the fried rice dishes without soy sauce and are also able to make changes to some dishes to make them gf. I have never gotten sick from eating here. Very impressed with this place and will definitely return!

I don't want to share the fact that I go here every chance I get, but how can I not share the fact that the food is good, cheap and you get a lot for your money.  I used to go to their Chinatown location, then started going to the Fort Apache location and now that there is one literally 5 mins from my house, it just makes it too easy to order for pick up or dine in.

So far, I've shared this restaurant with all my coworkers and they all LOVE this place.  Everyone's favorite (including myself) has been the duck noodle soup, I get mine with egg noodles and add wonton.  For a year or two, it was the ONLY dish I would order...I would look over the menu and tell myself I was going to try something else but always went back to the duck noodle soup..crazy right?  Well one day, I saw a Vietnamese family all order the same thing at the table next to us.  I asked the waiter what they were eating and discovered Rad Na...so I started ordering Rad Na for a while.  It was delicious!  Flat rice noodles with Chinese broccoli and your chose of meat in a yummy gravy..my mouth is watering just thinking about it!

Gradually I've worked through the menu, it was been at least 5 years since I've discovered Thai Style Noodle House and I have to say my current crush and my go to lately is their Pad See Eew and their Spicy Eggplant with rice, but the must have with any rice dish (you can find it on their sides menu) is their egg omelette with pork.

Are they the BEST in Vegas? No if you take into account Lotus of Siam, BUT, they are great if you don't want to spend an arm and a leg. AND if you know me, you know I LOVE noodles and they are the only place in Vegas if you want delicious Thai boat noodle soups!!
The red curry was awesome. The service was great and our food didn't take long to come. I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well. The art on the wall is beautiful. Definitely going back again!

Beautiful spacious restaurant. I usually go to the Fort Apache location. We ordered my usual, chicken pad thai and shrimp tom yum soup. My friend wanted to try duck fried rice. Everything is too salty here. The fried rice was too dark (as if the chef accidentally poured an entire bottle of extra dark soy sauce in the rice). Usually the color of fried rice is nice and pretty but the entire dish was one color...dark brown. 

I ordered the mango sticky rice to share. Was good, but you can't mess that one up. 

I'll probably stick to the Fort Apache location, the food there is much better and not just salty.

This was out first time coming here. It was horrible experience. We entered the restaurant and the server said "wait".  After we were seated, she dropped the menus on the table and walked away. I was in shock the way we're were being treated. Then I noticed a male in the kitchen eating while prepping food. Then the server came over and asked if we wanted something to drink. We said no as we were talking about leaving. She walked away and rolled her eyes. We walked out with out ordering. I will never return here.
My go to Thai place! Inexpensive compared to other Thai restaurants and food is always fresh and flavorful. Love the papaya salad and seafood pad see ew.

This place has good thai food, though it is a little low on the spice index for my tastes (but I like my food only a little less hot than the temperature of the sun, lol).

The most outstanding part of the experience was my server Kitty. She was wonderful and quick to bring me my dish. She also made great suggestions for house dishes such as the House Tom Yum soup. 

I know I will keep coming back just to be served by her. If you come, I suggest trying to get her!

The food was good and fast. The place is clean and the staff was great. Plenty of seating. 
The food all looks great and tastes good.

Thai Style Noodle House is consistent all around. Mainstream and pretty authentic. I've been to the location in Chinatown and Fort Apache, but this location (Jones) is my favorite. Very clean, open, modern with good food. 

My go to dishes are: 
Thai noodle soups (beef, combo, roast duck)
Pad Thai 
Spicy Noodles 
Grilled Beef Salad 
Pot Stickers

Service has always been consistent and prices are reasonable. I return often when in town.

I'm a frequent patron at Thai restaurants, this place is pretty good.  The portions of some dishes are too small for the price (some appetizers) however the entrees are well proportioned.  They play modern music here if you're not a fan of traditional Thai music.  I can't say too much on how different it is, being a chain, it's not gonna differ to much from the other Style noodle house I've been to.  This place isn't my favorite but it's not at all bad or not worth visiting for a bite.

2stars for the food, it is ok .. They won't make your food or drinks to your specification without giving an attitude. The worst service I have experienced in visiting Las Vegas in 15 years. Never asked how things were once food was delivered. Brought dishes at seperate times. I could go on . I guess they have never heard of Yelp.
Worst $7.85 I've ever spent. it was less than a scoop of chicken and about 3/4 of the to go plate was rice! will DEFINITELY NOT order from here again!

I really do enjoy the food here but their customer service is sometimes a hit or miss. Some days I am able to get a rice dish as an ala cart, some days I am told I cannot....i also like to get extra meat on my favorite dish (crispy pork w/Chinese broccoli) but sometimes I feel it is a burden to ask when the person on the phone goes "ughhhh *sigh* lemme ask if I can do that be cause it's extra" And yes I don't mind paying the $3 something extra meat fee.
Excellent thai food, fast service at a great price! Really can't go wrong. Only thing that was far from exceptional was the mango in the mango sticky rice dessert. Mango was VERY sour.

Lets start with the positives of the restaurant... Place looks nice. Food was very flavorful! 

However, I was very upset with the fact that I had to wait 45+ minutes for my Thai Yellow Chicken Curry and inconsistency with portion. The table next to me ordered Thai Yellow Chicken Curry and it was delivered to their table within 15 minutes, plus their portion was significantly bigger. My portion was much smaller in comparison. 

Although I acknowledge that they were short on staff, tables wasn't cleaned up after people left. They started cleaning tables based on when new people needed table. Unprofessional practice. 

Lastly, I had to flag down the waiter 5+ times to get my water refilled. It wasn't until the 5th time, the waiter refilled the water cup. 

I will not come back here again.

I ordered Thai Style Noodle House through UberEATS for a quick lunch. 

The menu had all the usual Thai dishes as well as others that seemed more authentic. I liked the selection. Pricing seemed lower than other Thai restaurants I frequent as well. 

Despite all the great sounding dishes I went for Pad Thai with chicken since I was craving it. The Pad Thai was great in flavor, but the noodles were hard like they weren't cooked long enough. It was off-putting. The chicken was in small pieces and there wasn't much of it. The dish was much better as leftovers the next day when the noodles softened in the sauce. 

I ordered salad with peanut sauce, but the restaurant forgot to include the salad in the bag. I did taste the peanut sauce and thought it tasted great. 

Overall, this was the first time a restaurant forgot part of my order and I'd rank the Pad Thai at the bottom of others I've had. I might give them another try when I need a quick lunch and try another dish from the menu.
Good food good service! Great place to go on lunch hour as they have very speedy service. The chicken chicken satay and potstickers are really really good. I liked the pineapple fried rice as well.
The staff was nice but the food was so-so.  Nothing in the way of ambience either. I don't plan on coming back. :(
I can sit here and write an essay about how terrible the service is here but I won't, just because the food is amazingly good. S/O to the people in the back cooking it up.

The first Pad Thai I've tried in Vegas I've actually enjoyed! 

I went with one of my girlfriends and we wanted to fill up on some delicious Thai carbs. We got Pad Thai, Pad See Eu and Thai Spice Noodle. I love spicy food but I know Thai restaurants don't joke about their spice so I ordered mine a spice of 7/10. The spiciness was just right and I was very happy with the Pad Thai. 

The Thai Spice Noodle was good too, however it had a lot of cilantro in it which gave it too much of a herbal taste for me. To be honest, I thought the Pad See Eu was pretty tasteless... I brought it home for my roommate who was starving and we stir fried it over the wok adding in more flavor.

Three noodle dishes were around $22 or so, incredibly affordable! I would definitely return here for the Pad Thai as it is my favorite Thai dish. Absolutely delish!
Good food but cook was taking naps in the bathroom.......over all good Tom yum one of the best Tom yum I've had

Ordered veggie pad thai via UberEATS from here, however accidentally received chicken pad thai. I contacted the restaurant and spoke to someone named Pang. She was extremely apologetic and nice, and did take care of the problem after I informed her there's no phone number i can find to contact UberEATS as she asked. Although i was disappointed at first and had to have my husband pick up the new order, their customer service did seem to make up for it!
Pad thai was delicious.
Will definitely be ordering again.

Came here for lunch when Soho was closed and the bar wasn't serving food. We figured why not? Came in and waited to be seated about 5 minutes. Took about 15 minutes before anyone came to take an order for drinks. They finally came and took a drink order and little bit after they took out food order. Coworker asked for a lemon for her water but... they were all out of lemons. Good gets there, I ordered the Tom Kha soup. It was delicious! I saw they had stocky rice with mango so I asked to order it but... they were out of mango. Not only that but the guy was rude about it. So anther server brings us the bill and I ask him to please add an order of sweet sticky rice since I remembered I had a mango at the office. He takes the bill and the guy who said they were out of mango looks at me and says "You didn't order the rice." So I said "I asked him to please place an order of the rice on my bill." He rolled his eyes and left  to clean up a table. The other server brings me my bill back and... No Sticky Rice. That means they didn't place the order. We grab or stuff and go. I give it a 2 not because of the food,  but the service was horrible. I might order from her again,  but only if it's to go. They can keep their attitude. I'd rather go to Archi's for thai food. Service is better.

Let me start by saying the setting of the resturant is beautiful. It's not old or run downed, very elegant and up to date.

Their service on the other hand, horrible!!

First off, when we got there a lady brought us water, with 1 little piece of ice? Not a big deal ok, but then we noticed all our drinks had things floating around in it?? We ask the lady to get us new waters. She kindly did, brought it back again with no ice. I asked for ice because I like my beverages cold. She tells me "oh the ice is dirty" I'm like dirty? She said "yes that's what's floating in your water."

Should have just walked out then.. Regretted it.

We ordered our food, ordered SHRIMP FRIED RICE, Pad Thai and Padse eww.

The lady brings us SHRIMP rolls and states "I'm sorry for the Inconvience" we atomatically assumed it was a comped treat due to the fact that they had dirty ice in our drinks. So we ate it!

Then they gave us the pad Thai, don't get me wrong it was alright. Could have been better.

And 15 min later came out with the pad se eww, we thought the fried rice was coming since the food was taking forever to get to the table. Finally 15 min after we got the pad se eww, we asked where our SHRIMP FRIED RICE was. The lady comes and tells me there no record of that order, when the server clearly repeated my orders to me before he walked away! Oh already livid she brings me the check..

AND GUESS WHAT!

She charged me for the shrimp rolls that I DIDNT ORDER! I asked her why she charged me, stating that I ordered shrimp fried rice and you didn't get me that not shrimp rolls. 
She then asked "why did you eat it?" I informed her we assumed it was compd since you said sorry for the Inconvience when giving it to us.

She then went to talk to the chief and server and came back stating THEY!! READ THAT, she said THEY!! Made a mistake with my friends rice & that we ate it so we have to charge you. I informed her if I knew you ordered it for us, then we wouldn't have at it.

The food was alright, but not alright enough so I'm definetly NOT coming back, nor would I recommend this place to anyone.

GET IT TOGETHER PEOPLE!

#1 place to get a genuine thai iced tea if you're craving one. It usually lasts me two days if I order one for myself. 

But also their food is a plus. My boyfriend and I always come here when we're craving panang curry, which is awesome!

The food overall was pretty delicious. We ordered the panang curry with chicken, tom kha, and shrimp pad Thai. Dishes have a spiciness rating from 1 to 10; 10 being the spiciest. We ordered the tom kha and pad Thai with a 6 and the panang with 7. The spiciness was pretty consistent with the spiciness rating and the meals had a good enough quantity to fill us up & take the rest home.

Also, delivery from this place is good. Sometimes the food will get to your place faster than the estimated time they say it will be, which is always a plus.

Me & my gf were originally going to eat at SOHO Japanese Restaurant, but there was a 20 minute wait. We noticed this restaurant next door & it wasn't as busy. I've been to Archie's & Pin Kaow which are two other popular Thai restaurants in the area, but this restaurant is now my favorite Thai restaurant. You get a good size portion of food for whatever entree you order for a really decent price. We had food leftover to take home. I definitely would recommend having the papaya salad & Mongolian beef which was what I ordered. My gf had Thai beef fried rice & crispy noodles which was also very delicious. This is definitely a place you have to try out if you love Thai food!

So glad this place opened right down the street from me! The BBQ pork wonton soup with egg noodles is AMAZING! & their Mongolian beef was delicious as well as the sticky rice!

Can't forget about the dessert either. Fried bananas & then the shop next door with the macaroon ice cream sandwiches are heaven!!!!!!

This is an average type of place. The food, the service and the ambiance are all adequate, but nothing special. It's priced fairly for what you get. If you are looking for a night that you will forget  or are hoping for "nothing special" and you aren't in a hurry to get your drinks refilled then this is the spot for you.

Another great time in Vegas!  We found this location last year and loved it!   I was so excited that it hasn't changed.   The atmosphere was pleasant.  Quiet soft rock music in the background and tvs for us to watch nearby.  Nok, our server was great!   She was very attentive and kept the iced tea coming.  

Our food was really good.  I had Thai fried rice and my husband had Pad Thai.  And of course our egg roll appetizer was fried to perfection.   We will be back next year when we come back to town.

[CUISINE]
I love the food at the other location. At this location the first time I came the Khua Kai was consistent with the other location. On my second visit it was not appetizing. The noodles were barely seared and there was a pile of pepper in the center of my dish. If this was my first time here it would be unlikely that I would return. :( I love the food at the other location so much so I may try it again. It could be that they are new and working out the kinks so I may give it another shot.


[DECOR]
I'm a huge fan of the other location on Tropicana and Ft. Apache. This location is a little awkward. It's too spacious and it feels very empty and unwelcoming.

[SERVICE]
When I arrived the server was assisting a to go order at the register. If I hadn't been to their other location I wouldn't have known that I needed to wait to be seated. The server didn't greet me with so much as a smile while she was assisting her other guest or say "I'll be right with you". I would recommend putting a sign to the right of the entrance similar to the other location that says "please wait to be seated" along with a sofa or bench where people can sit while they are waiting to be assisted. Currently there is just a tall plant there. 

My plate arrived almost 10 minutes after my husbands plate did. I had requested extra sauce and had to repeat my request when my plate arrived, and again after I finished half of my meal. About 15-20 minutes before the bill arrived I finished my Thai tea and wanted some water but the server never stopped by my table. During our meal there were 2 servers and three tables including ours... 

[PRICE]
The prices are very very cheap. Ranging from $7-$10

This food was very good. We had the orange chicken, pot stickers and Tom Kai soup. The servings portions are large. The bathrooms, not so clean. We went to the jones location and will definitely go back! This is our new favorite Thai in Las Vegas.
When at noon order my  favorite cucumber salad said they were out cause they ran out of cucumber really

There are things to like and then there are things not to like with this place. 

It's your regular American dumb down Thai food.  I had the Tom Yum Noodle Soup, and one word described the soup - sour.  Trust me, tom yum soup is MUCH more complex than just that.  

But then, for $6.95, the bowl of soup was pretty filling and I must say I was please with the portion for that price. 

On the other hand, the service I got towards the end with the male cashier will stop me from returning as a patron.  The girl who took my order and served my table was very nice and knew the meaning of customer service.  But the male cashier was beyond rude.  He refused to acknowledge me as I was standing in front of him waiting for my check.  I guess he was too busy sliding a credit card through the machine and couldn't possibly look up and smile and ask me to wait a minute.  

Nope.  I'd rather pay a little more for better food AND service from the man who is taking my money.
Thought the food was really good. The prices are really reasonable. The decor is very modern and clean. it's a nice look compared to other Thai places that I've been to.

The food here is incredibly good. The portions on the plates are just enough to satisfy. The menu is extensive serving most of the thai traditional dishes. Compared to other places, this restaurant is not expensive at all but even if it was the food would be well worth it. Seems like its been remodeled cause the seating booths are nice and firm. The place is clean with 3 huge wall-mounted TV displays. If you're in the area I highly recommend Thai Style Noodle House.

Pretty walking in, but the allure ended there. We stood at the entranceway waiting to be seated while the servers were staring at us from the cashier stand; if they weren't going to seat us right away, a greeting would've been nice. 
The food was not that great. We ordered the pad see eu which was starchy tasting, and the pad ped snapper, which was pieces of fried fish fillets with veggies in curry. 
We also ended up waiting an extremely long time before getting the check, probably because they hardly ever checked on us. 
Definitely not impressed. If you want good Thai food with decent service, drive the extra mile to Pin Kaow or even Archi's.

We order the Thai spicy noodle, combination thai fried rice and a side of sticky rice. The thai spicy noodle wasn't that spicy and it taste ok.  The combination fried rice taste average. The customer service suck.

The food was awesome, they were slow but our server is very attentive, I got the bbq pork with fried rice then babe has noodles idk what it called then got a calamari for appetizer  I give 4 stars because they do chit chat and didn't ask if we wanted the bill or anything

Ok, so I have ordered here numerous of times. I always ask for spice as 10. Yes it had a kick to it. Tonight I was like I want spicy. Not your ten. I want real spicy Thai food. She was like are you sure? Yes I am sure. We always want it with more spice. Let me tell you.... EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. EVERYTHING! Plus the service was amazing. They kept asking and saying no return because of spice. No way. It made it 10 times better. If you really like spice don't do the 10. Just tell them I really like the spice. They will make it to the T.

Everything I have ever ate from there is amazing. Take out, dine in, they always take care of you. Just really be specific. Just amazing food!

Usually go to the one in Chinatown, which is always busy but the service is consistent and the food is always amazing. Came to this newly opened location, and although the decor is a lot nicer and the food still very delicious, the service left a lot to be desired. 

Came here on a Sunday afternoon, besides us, there were two, three other tables. Not busy at all. Two servers were present, and the entire time we were there, no one came to check on us, and we had to get their attention every time for them to give us napkins (which should've been given from the beginning anyway); to fill our waters; and then to get a box and then the bill. When we were ready for them to take the card, once again, we had to wave to them for them to come and get it, after waiting for at least 5 minutes. Every time the two of them were just leaning against the walls, not even busy or doing anything at all. I mean, someone's gotta make sure the wall isn't falling over, right?

Like I mentioned, the food was just as good as the other locations, price still really cheap, but the service really sucked. Won't return.

My favorite Thai restaurant in all of Las Vegas, and I've been eating A LOT of Thai food these past few years.

It's just the combination of: 
- Everything tastes good
- The service is decent
- The environment is new, clean, and visually appealing with comfy booth seats
- The prices are virtually as low as it gets!

I just wish they had a location on the east side, because then I wouldn't go to any other Thai restaurant.

(Another great thing- it's adjacent to a dessert/boba place open til 4am daily with a ton of vegan options! After dinner at Thai Style, just go next door for dessert, a digestif, to hang out, or if you just want to prolong a date!

So far the best Thai restaurant I've been to. I've tried other Thai restaurants but I always find myself coming back to this place. The service is fast and excellent. The food are on point and very well seasoned. The price is very cheap. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Omg yaaassss!!!! 
Spicy level 9 is the business!

I'm one to always request a large side of limes and extra spice. Not this place! To perfection!!!

Prices are just Right also!! :D

Happy belly happy guest!

Excellent thai food. We ordered chicken pad tai and BBQ pork wonton soup to go. People who worked there were very nice. Also it is very clean and new inside. I did not know they had seating or would just have eaten there. Can't wait to return.

Common question of a work day: "What's for lunch?" 

Common answer: "Thai"

I love Thai places at lunch that offer lunch specials because it's such a bang for your buck. Recently, my go-to, Archi's failed me. Disappointed with their pad thai, I was left to venture out other spots. 

Guess what? Thai Style Noodle House does NOT offer lunch specials, but their prices, portions, and taste make up for it! 

The pad thai was pretty good, not the best. It came out with a zero spice level, due to the server not asking "how spicy." I had to ask for the spice rack to cater to my taste buds. I also ask for lime, which they did not have. Um, ok. They had lime juice, which I accepted. 

Yellow curry with tofu was tasty and they really hook you up with the tofu! The curry did not taste sickly sweet like some other places. 

Since my child was with me, I opted for a "bland" side dish. I got the scrambled egg with ground pork dish for $3ish. Perfect. It looked and tasted like a Filipino torta. It was a big portion and only dented 1/6 of it. 

Those on 30 minute lunches, I would advise calling in your order and picking up. Those with 1 hour lunches, it may not be realistic to dine in either. From ordering to receiving our food, was about 30 minutes. Then you have consider driving to and from, plus actual eating time, paying, and boxing everything up. 

Interior is cool, modern, and spacious. Seating is like 90% booths. Service was average.

Can't wait to return and try more menu items!

Nice place! Atmosphere is a little quiet for my liking and the walls need to not be bare white. Also needs more decorations to make it feel more Thai. 

Prices are really cheap compared to other restaurants. Portion sizes are big enough to make you feel gross after a meal.
Love the tom yum noodle. I ordered spicy level 9 but instead it was pretty sour. It is still edible. :)
Same menu just like the other ones. The New decor is nicer than the other ones hands down
Great food. One of the best value in town    Rice dishes and noodles are both good. Nice local joint

One of my favorite Thai places to eat here in LV. Located by the SW corner or Jones and Warm Springs and very easy to get to. It's not the best Thai restaurant I've had, but for the price and quality of the food. It cannot be beat! 

The restaurant is very clean. There are a bunch of booths available that keep you secluded from the other booths; a plus in my book when it comes to eating with some privacy. There are big, flat screen TVs mounted on the wall to kill time while waiting for your food (which isn't even long in the first place). 

My go-to dishes are always the Pad See Ew and Panang curry. I've tried their other items but these two never fail me (and they're just that good!).

Whether you eat here, or call in for to go, you won't be disappointed. I am seated right away and if I call in for to go, I can count on my food being ready in about 15 minutes.

Last night, the server, whom goes by the name "Liek", went above and beyond with her customer service skills. She was really attentive, friendly, and personable...especially with my son. He accidentally spilled his water and without hesitation, both workers came to the rescue to help get our food to another booth and get it all cleaned up right away. "Liek" came to our table more than I've ever had a server come to our table, to ask how we were doing, how's the food, and if we needed anything. Although it wasn't busy, I was impressed with the extra attention and service we were getting. It made me feel bad for my last review I posted. My son went to use the restroom prior to leaving and "Liek" came by to ask if the bathroom was okay. She needs to be there more often! She definitely made the case of my Monday turn into a happy Monday.

We ordered calamari, seafood wonton soup with vermecilli noodles, and spicy eggplant with chicken. My oh my, was everything tasteful and to our liking. The spice was on point and that's a huge plus! I'm definitely ordering the soup all the time we're here. My allergies have been triggered tremendously and the soup definitely did my body good.

My coworkers and I decided for a Thai food night. Place is really clean and the food is great. It's just the service that sucked. We had to keep calling them over to either get us a refill or if we wanted to order more food. Giving it 4 stars well 4.5 since service wasn't so great the first time, but I came today with my mom and sister, and service was great. I didn't get her name, but she was very polite and smiled during our whole stay. Will defiantly be coming back for a third time . 
Also the price for the amount of food you get is perfect!
Polite and quick. I ordered duck fried rice and chicken wings to go. Took about twenty minutes. Tastes great! Definitely coming back to explore the menu some more.
I accidently found this place on Christmas eve. I am so glad that I did. The food was so good, service was excellent, the prices were unbeatable. Thank you for being open on that day!!!

Came here with a friend for dinner around 7:30, and the place was empty.  A few people came and got takeout while we were there, and I wonder if others - never having been there before - think it isn't a sit down restaurant?  I don't know, but you can sit down and eat your food there.

I think this place would've gotten more stars from me if the portion sizes had been a little bigger, for one - they seemed to be on the small size for my taste; and also, there were only a few vegetarian options on the menu.  And... this might sound nitpicky, but... the vibe of the place is kind of bland for me, honestly.  There's nothing special about the way it looks or feels, which isn't something I usually complain about, but I feel like a lot could have been added to my experience if the place had a little more character.

That being said, the servers we had were friendly and checked in on us a few times throughout the meal, refilled our drinks when we were nearly out, etc.  So, good service.  And the food was good, as well.  Since most people get takeout here, you're likely to have the place almost entirely to yourself if you come here to eat.

We arrived at 4:30 on Friday to an almost empty restaurant with 3 servers who need to brush up on the English language.  We asked several questions since many items were unknown to us, though we're very Thai-food-savvy.  Our server recommended the Three Flavor Grill Salmon which we ordered, along with the Pumpkin Curry with chicken, both dishes at $8.95@.  

First, the atmosphere...  the restaurant is large for an Asian one & the booths are painted bright purple, with unusual seating configurations.  If we had known before ordering that the radio was coming on with news, etc. we'd have made our exit.  Second, the rice... it was not Jasmine but a very cheap variety.  The silverware is for picnics & the small white plates are plastic.  

Third, the food... the pumpkin (butternut squash) was too soft and the sauce really tasted canned.  The other ingredients are what I dislike in Asian food, big chunks of white onion, carrots & green bell pepper.  As for the salmon with chopped chicken, it was very fishy & the sweet sauce tasted, again, like canned & not fitting for these ingredients (which also contained the onion, green bell & carrots).  No basil or other greens were on the plates.  And our server never came over to inquire how we liked the food & when we got to the salmon dish, called her over to complain about the very fishy taste.  No substitute was offered.

The menu choices look terrific & all prices are reasonable.  If you are, however, familiar with Thai food & have enjoyed it all around town, I believe you'd be disappointed here.  I think I've learned my lesson... if someone recommends a restaurant, I'll first ask how many times they've dined out on the particular cuisine, and where.  In the meantime, we're staying with our tried & true in Thai cuisine.

Great Thai place if you're looking for quick take out orders! We had the chicken fried rice and chicken pad thai which totaled to $15! Not bad for how pricey some Thai places can get. The service was great from when we first walked in. Greeted cheerfully by the staff and asked if we were dining in or taking out. The chicken fried rice was delicious and light. It did not feel oily like how other Asian style fried rice dishes can be. The chicken and rice was seasoned well too. I ordered the chicken pad thai spicy level 6 (1-10 scale). Unlike other places where spiciness can overpower flavor, their take on it balanced both really well. The peppery heat from the spice came first with each bite, followed by the savory flavors every pad thai dish has. Similar to the fried rice, the chicken was seasoned well and complimented the flavors of the dish. The great food, friendly and quick service and the 5% yelp cash back are all the reasons I'll be coming back whenever I'm craving Thai food on this side of town!

I've been to this place a couple times and honestly each time it gets worse and worse. This time I got the pad see ew and it tastes like burnt rubber, and the service was rude too. With plenty of Thai food spots in the area, why even bother going here

Tried the calamari appetizer was nice and hot served with a sweet n sour sauce great tasting. Just ordered shrimp pad thai hoping it's good. Pad thai os great I like a 5 medium hot.  Please inspect your food throughly as it may have some non food items. I ate around metal sponge string other people however might not want that in with their food.

1- clean nice environment . Too clean if you find a string for s dishwasher in your meal. 
2 - modern style restaurant seems new or remodeled.
3 not too busy in a Thursday evening 4 pm
4. Good food 
5 good service .

I was visiting from out of town working nearby. Will eat here again. Top quality Thai food. I didn't order anything special - egg rolls, pot stickers and pad Thai. Pretty sure it's the best I've ever had.
Nice new spot for a quick lunch.  Good food,  very affordable,  clean inside and solid service. Worth checking out if you are in the area.

Thai Style Noodle House has the best crab ragoon I've found anywhere in Las Vegas....and I've tried quite a few Thai restaurants in town. The food is consistently good and the food is always made fresh, modified to my request without question. TSNH is a go-to pick-up spot for dinner on my way home from work multiple times a month.

Rude service ever. I've come here numerous of times and never felt welcomed. This is my last time coming here. I don't like spicy food and made that aware to the server everytime I come here and I've never had an issue until tonight. I always order the panag curry zero spice but someone on my table also ordered it with a level 6 spice. I knew I'd have an issue as they would cook the sauces together and I'd be stuck with a spicy dish. And that's exactly what I got. I told the server and she got offended and was extremely rude to me. She made a comment asking asking if we've ever been to the restaurant before and we told her we've come myliplte of times and I always order this with zero spice. She then said that she never saw us here before and that this dish is always spicey no matter what spice level you tell your server. In my head I'm like why ask what spice level of it's going to be hella spicy anyway AND I've had this exact item multiple of times and it's never been spicy. But I just ignored her rudeness and didn't finish my food and she still charged me for it. I'm so disappointed with the service here. This was the mini female with short hair. Rude.

Solid Chicken Pad Thai.
Not so fast service.
I gave this place 3 stars because they have bomb ass food but they didn't get 5 because the service is just so bad. Pretty rude, but the food is pretty good.
Service was good.  Food was excellent,  and the venue is clean.  I suggest the Pumpkin Curry.
Great hole in the wall eatery. The portion size is unbelievable and the dishes come out piping hot and ready to devour.  Great service, attentive wait staff and plenty to chose from on the menu.
Ordered from this place  many times. Try pad thai with shrimps, duck fried rice and potstickers. Good food.

This is now one of my favorite Thai place spots. I just stumbled upon this place because I was craving Thai food. Looked up Thai restaurants nearby and boom! :) The aura / design of this place is pretty clean and simple. Looks like they're still trying to redecorate the place. Looks really good though! So, I had ordered dinner to go and the lady who helped me was extremely helpful and friendly. Their pad Thai is awesome, and chicken wings is super yummy and crispy too! Awesome find for sure.

Omg, the chicken coconut soup is amazing. We got this a ton over the winter and it always hit the spot. The only down side to this soup is the amount of lemongrass stems still in the soup. They are totally inedible so you really have to work your way around them but other then that it's a great soup. 

The servings here are closer to a tapas style size so try and order some dishes that you could share among the table. We normally order the soup along with a beef and broccoli and a a spicy chicken dish for two and we finish off most everything, we like food!  The Beef and broccoli is a little greasy but it has delicious flavor. The coconut soup takes the cake though. Get it.

Tried this place out because of Uber eats. The prices are great and so is most of the food I've gotten from there. 
Foods that I've had and liked: 
Beef Pad See Ew 
Orange Chicken 
Kung Pao Chicken 
Thai Coffee 
Fried Rice 

Only thing I had and wasn't a fan of was the chicken panang curry. The sauce was watery, and the chicken was tiny strips that have a weird texture and there just wasn't much of it. It was mostly just water sauce and rice. It wasn't horrible, but I want order that again.

My mom was craving wonton noodle soup so I took to yelp and ended up here. The soup was lukewarm and not very tasty. My mom was pretty disappointed. I ordered the seafood salad and thought the dressing was too sour for it being with seafood. On top of poor customer service the waitress was pretty rude with us and beware, they're very cheap with paper napkins. We had a spill so asked for an extra napkin and it never came...probably won't be back to this location. What a bummer.

Service....eh...not so great. The atmosphere....Sophisticated Minimalist decor. It really was pretty nice. My 5yr old son enjoyed it. 

This was my husband and son's first Thai experience. They both really enjoyed the food. We ordered Chicken Pad See Eu, Bbq pork wonton soup, and fried chicken over fried rice. Everything was great. The fried chicken was a sweeter version of chicken katsu. It was delicious. I do have to say that the restaurant serves soda from the can. It's weird. I'm assuming refills aren't free. We decided not to find out and had water as well. Overall very good and great prices.
This place is great! It's at a good price, service is great, and food comes out fast! I recommend the pad see ew! Go ahead and try it!

They don't even deserve this one star and I wish it were possible to give negative stars cause that's how disappointed. When we came in we were not greeted by anyone, stood around for 5 minutes, when we went to seat we wait over 10 minutes and didn't even get a menu. The service was horrible and the food worse. Everyone agreed that the food was too salty so we probably won't go back here!!

I love there food and go there once a week but one employee has ruined my whole experience very rude lacking customer service skills. I called to place an order and she argues with me about a dish I've been getting once to twice a week for months I no longer will visit this location EVER.
The cheapest Thai food in town, and also the tastiest. Greasy, yummy, flavorful and spicy Thai food just like you like it. 3 things ordered for 25$! Crazy.

The foods good, but they need to be able to accommodate customers better. For example: I would like to add meat for my fried rice and don't mind to pay extra (obviously), they should be able to do that, no?? It's extra money. Wth?!
And another thing, when I called at 9:39 PM to pick up some food to go, knowing they closed at 10, but apparently I can't, because they're already closed the kitchen... so yeah alls I'm saying is that if it wasn't because of the food and the location so close to my home, I'd never come back. And you need to consider these things if you want to create more sales and more returned customers..

I'm so disappointed with this place. My finance and I decided to grab some Thai food tonight. So of course I search Yelp and Noodle House 4 was on the list. I've been to the one on Fort Apache numerous times and I've never had an issue or a complaint. Well this one really ruined it for all the Noodle House spots. 

So my fianc√© orders the jungle curry with no meat just veggies. The waitress asked him how spicy from 1-10 and he specifically said 2. I even made fun of him for choosing a 2. He does not do well with spicy food. I order the Pad Thai and ask for a level 4. I love spicy food but tonight I was going to take it easy and just do a 4. 

Our food arrives and guess what?? My Fianc√©s Jungle Curry tasted like a 10. He started coughing from just breathing in the broth. So of course I had to test it out because what's spicy to him is not to me. He wasn't kidding...I mean his meal was even way too spicy for me. It was inedible. How is it that his food was way more spicy than mine and I ordered a 4?!? I call for the waitress and I explained, she then sends over this guy so then I explain to him. He looked over at me and asked me if I eat spicy food. I replied "yes, I eat spicy food"! I told him I ordered a level 4 in spice and my food isn't even  close to how spicy his is. The point is my fianc√© ordered a 2 out of a 10 and his meal was over a 10. 

The waitress said he is going to bring some of the broth to take down the spice. Umm okay. How about you replace his inedible meal? We are not asking for a refund just food we can actually enjoy. So instead he brought hot water or some kind of broth and sugar?? No joke. See photos attached. How can you even think that's okay as a business owner?? This restaurant isn't going to make it. I'm sorry to say but you're competing with thousands of  amazing Thai restaurants in Vegas that would never treat a customer this way. Be kind to your customers and they will be kind to you. I wish I could say good luck but I don't think that will help.

Spacious and modern interior, very nice and neat.
Mongolian beef is very salty. Beef is not tender, and you can't taste anything but the soy sauce.
Roasted duck, the broth is on the sweet side. Feeling impressed at the first sips, but got tired of the way too sweet taste and can't drink more. 
Wonton is big but juicy and flavorful. 
The highlight of the whole meal is the shrimp rolls which are perfectly deep fried, thin crispy wrap and a fresh shrimp inside!

This is my go to place whenever I'm craving Thai! The prices are acceptable and the food is delicious. Crab Rangoons and shrimp padthai will always be my favorite. Customer service is awesome, I've ordered delivery from them once and it came at a reasonable time. No complains so far, I will keep coming back :)

Best Thai ever! I cannot find Anywhere as good as this place! Wish they opened one in California! Staff are so sweet and remember what I order when I come in, Tom Kai with no lemongrass lol. Hands down best Thai

Having been to other Thai Style Noodle House locations in town, I knew pretty much what to expect and was pretty excited to have a location closer to me.

The restaurant is cute. Very modern and spacious. So far I have tried the shrimp and avocado panang and the crispy pork and basil dishes. The panang was perfect. Creamy, the perfect texture and flavor. The servings or rice were really generous. We first thought we were sharing the one they brought us and then were surprised when they brought us another plate. The pork with basil was amazing too. Spicy and great flavor. The veggies were crunchy and perfectly cooked.

I'm so excited about this new location and I can't wait until they start offering delivery.
Good food, quick service, unbeatable price. My favorite dishes are the tom ka soup and the duck soup.

Came here with a bunch coworkers for lunch. Ordered a Thai style noodle. Chicken was not very dry but could be cooked better. At this point I would have rated the place an average 3 star. Then a friend ordered a large Thai ice tea, and it literally came in a soup container!  adding one star for taking our orders "literally" lol!

I found this Thai place by searching for nearby Thai restaurants and it was a huge success. The ambience of the little place is modern and chic, with personal touches of hand painted art above the booths. The food was amazing. I had the Spicy Thai Noodles with beef and my friend had the traditional pad Thai with chicken. It was all delicious and the flavors were spot on and exceeded our expectations. The staff was super attentive as well. Give this little gem a shot the next time you crave Thai food.
